  4411                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4412                                  
  4413                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4414                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4415                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4416                                  
  4417                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4418                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4419                                  		;=============================================================
  4420                                  		;
  4421                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4422                                  		;
  4423                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4424                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4425                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4426                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4427                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4428                                  
  4429                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4430                                  		;=============================================================
  4431                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4432                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4433                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4434                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4435                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4436                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4437                                  		
  4438 00001772 FA                      		cli
  4439                                  
  4440                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4441                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4442                                  		;push	ax
  4443                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4444                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4445                                  		;pop	ax
  4446                                  	
  4447                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4448                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4449                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4450                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4451                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4452                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4453                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4454                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4455                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4456                                  
  4457                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4458                                  
  4459                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4460                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4461                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4462                                  
  4463 00001773 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4464 00001777 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4465                                  
  4466                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4467                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4468                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4469                                  
  4470 0000177C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4471 0000177D 07                      		pop	es
  4472 0000177E 51                      		push	cx
  4473 0000177F 57                      		push	di
  4474                                  
  4475                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4476                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4477                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4478                                  		; ds = cs
  4479 00001780 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4480 00001782 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4481                                  		; ds = 0
  4482                                  
  4483 00001784 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4484                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4485                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4486                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4487 00001786 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4488                                  next_int_:		
  4489 00001789 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4490 0000178A AC                      		lodsb		
  4491                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4492 0000178B 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4493 0000178C D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4494 0000178E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4495 00001790 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4496 00001792 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4497                                  					; saving address in di
  4498 00001794 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4499 00001795 AB                      		stosw
  4500 00001796 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4501 00001797 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  4502 00001798 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4503 0000179A E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  4504 0000179C 5F                      		pop	di
  4505 0000179D 59                      		pop	cx
  4506                                  
  4507                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4508                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4509                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4510                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4511                                  
  4512                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4513                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4514                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4515                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4516                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4517                                  
  4518                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4519 0000179E C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4520                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4521                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4522 000017A4 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4523                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4524 000017A8 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4525                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4526                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4527 000017AE 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4528                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4529 000017B2 C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4530                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4531                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4532 000017B8 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4533                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4534                                  
  4535                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4536 000017BC 0E                      		push	cs
  4537 000017BD 1F                      		pop	ds
  4538                                  		
  4539 000017BE A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4540 000017C1 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4541 000017C4 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4542 000017C7 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4543                                  					; ;
  4544 000017CA FB                      		sti
  4545 000017CB CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4546                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4547                                  
  4548                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4549                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4550                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4551                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4552                                  ;
  4553                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4554                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4555                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4556                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4557                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4558                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4559                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4560                                  
  4561                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4562                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4563                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4564                                  ;
  4565                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4566                                  ; to do anything special.
  4567                                  ;
  4568                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4569                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4570                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4571                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4572                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4573                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4574                                  
  4575                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4576 000017CD A801                    		test	al, 1
  4577                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4578 000017CF 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4579                                  
  4580                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4581                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4582                                  ;
  4583                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4584                                  ;
  4585                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4586                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4587                                  
  4588 000017D1 50                      		push	ax
  4589 000017D2 53                      		push	bx
  4590 000017D3 51                      		push	cx
  4591 000017D4 52                      		push	dx
  4592 000017D5 57                      		push	di
  4593 000017D6 06                      		push	es
  4594 000017D7 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4595 000017D9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4596 000017DB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4597                                  					; DL = drive number
  4598                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4599                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4600                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4601 000017DD 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4602                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4603                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4604                                  		; ds = cs
  4605 000017DF 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4606                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4607 000017E3 07                      		pop	es
  4608 000017E4 5F                      		pop	di
  4609 000017E5 5A                      		pop	dx
  4610 000017E6 59                      		pop	cx
  4611 000017E7 5B                      		pop	bx
  4612 000017E8 58                      		pop	ax
  4613 000017E9 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4614                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4615                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4616                                  
  4617                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4618                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4619                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4620                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4621 000017EB A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4622 000017EE 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4623 000017F0 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4624                                  
  4625                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4626                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4627 000017F2 48                      		dec	ax
  4628 000017F3 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs

  4630                                  
  4631                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4632                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4633 000017F5 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4634 000017F8 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4635                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4636                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4637                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4638 000017FB EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4639                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4640                                  
  4641                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4642 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4643 000017FF D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4644                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4645                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4646                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4647 00001801 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4648 00001803 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4649 00001805 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4650                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4651                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4652                                  		; ds = cs
  4653 00001806 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4654                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this

  4657                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4658                                  					; booted off hard file
  4659 0000180B 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4660                                  
  4661                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4662                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4663                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4664                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address

  4720                                  					; AKPORT
  4721                                  
  4722                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  4723                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running

  4733 00001855 A820                    		test	al, 20h

  4735 00001859 B00F                    		mov	al, 0Fh		; double check
  4736 0000185B E650                    		out	50h, al
  4737 0000185D E450                    		in	al, 50h

  5024                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5025                                  ; diskette drives:
  5026                                  ;
  5027                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5028                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5029                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5030                                  ;
  5031                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5032                                  ;
  5033                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5034                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5035                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5036                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5037                                  					
  5038 0000198F 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl

  5046 00001996 BF[1901]                		mov	di, start_bds 	; if we	are faking floppy drives we need
  5047                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5048                                  
  5049                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5050                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5051                                  
  5052                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5053                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5054                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5055                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5056                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5057                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5058                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5059                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5060

  5357                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5358                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5359                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5360                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5374                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5375                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table

  5377                                  ;of their current position memory.

  5379                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5380                                  ;
  5381                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5382                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5383                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5384                                  ;use to start with.
  5385                                  ;
  5386                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5387                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5388                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5389                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5390                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5391

  5463                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5464                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5465                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard

  5467                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5468                                  ; off of it.

  5470                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5471                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5472                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5473                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide

  5653                                  	;;;	mov	al, [drvfat]
  5654                                  
  5655                                  	; cas -- why do a SECOND setdrive here???
  5656                                  
  5657                                  		; 22/12/2022
  5658                                  		;push	es		; save whatever's in es
  5659                                  		;push	ds		; copy bds to es:di
  5660                                  		;pop	es
  5661                                  		;push	cs		; copy Bios_Data to ds
  5662                                  		;pop	ds
  5663                                  	
  5664                                  	; 22/12/2022
  5665                                  	;;;	mov	bp, SETDRIVE
  5666                                  	;;;	;mov	bp, 4D7h	; SetDrive (2C7h:47Dh = 70h:2A47h)
  5667                                  	;;;	push	cs		; simulate far call
  5668                                  	;;;	call	call_bios_code	; get correct bds for this drive
  5669                                  	
  5670                                  		; 22/12/2022
  5671                                  		;push	es		; copy bds back to ds:di
  5672                                  		;pop	ds
  5673                                  		;pop	es		; pop whatever was in es
  5674                                  
  5675                                  	; Now we load in the MSDOS.SYS file
  5676                                  
  5677                                  	; 22/12/2022
  5678                                  	; -----
  5679                                  	;	mov	bx, [di+6]	; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR]
  5680                                  	;	mov	[cs:md_sectorsize], bx	; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  5681                                  	;	mov	bl, [di+1Fh]	; [di+BDS.fatsiz]
  5682                                  	;				; get size of fat on media
  5683                                  	;	;mov	es:16DEh, bl
  5684                                  	;	mov	[es:fbigfat], bl
  5685                                  	;	mov	cl, [di+8]
  5686                                  	;	mov	ax, [di+17h] ; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS]
  5687                                  	;	;sub	es:16D8h, ax
  5688                                  	;	sub	[es:bios_l], ax	; subtract hidden sectors since we
  5689                                  	;				; need a logical sector number that will
  5690                                  	;				; be used by getclus(diskrd procedure)
  5691                                  	;	mov	ax, [di+19h] ; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS+2]
  5692                                  	;	;sbb	es:16DAh, ax
  5693                                  	;	sbb	[es:bios_h], ax	; subtract upper 16 bits of sector num
  5694                                  	; -----
  5695                                  		
  5696                                  	; -----	; 22/12/2022
  5697 00001C1F 268B5D06                		mov	bx, [es:di+6]	; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR]
  5698 00001C23 891E[D816]              		mov	[md_sectorsize], bx ; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  5699 00001C27 268A5D1F                		mov	bl, [es:di+1Fh]	; [di+BDS.fatsiz]
  5700                                  					; get size of fat on media
  5701 00001C2B 881E[D216]              		mov	[fbigfat], bl
  5702 00001C2F 268A4D08                		mov	cl, [es:di+8]
  5703 00001C33 268B4517                		mov	ax, [es:di+17h] ; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS]
  5704 00001C37 2906[CC16]              		sub	[bios_l], ax	; subtract hidden sectors since we
  5705                                  					; need a logical sector number that will
  5706                                  					; be used by getclus(diskrd procedure)
  5707 00001C3B 268B4519                		mov	ax, [es:di+19h] ; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS+2]
  5708 00001C3F 1906[CE16]              		sbb	[bios_h], ax	; subtract upper 16 bits of sector num
  5709                                  	; ------
  5710                                  
  5711 00001C43 30ED                    		xor	ch, ch	 ; cx = sectors/cluster
  5712                                  
  5713                                  	; the boot program has left the directory at 0:500h
  5714

  5716 00001C46 31FF                    		xor	di, di
  5717 00001C48 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di

  5721                                  					; of root directory in the buffer at 500h)

  5723                                  loadit:

  5725                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; sysinit segment

  5727 00001C54 268E06[7102]            		mov	es, [es:CURRENTDOSLOCATION] ; 09/12/2022
  5728                                  		;mov	es, [es:271h]
  5729

  5731                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  5737 00001C68 EB03                    		jmp	short iseofx

  5744 00001C6F E84104                  		call	setdrvparms	;

  5747                                  		;jmp	far 46Dh:267h
  5748 00001C72 EA[6702]5804            		jmp	SYSINITSEG:SYSINITSTART

  5750                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  5751                                  
  5752                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5753                                  ;
  5754                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5755                                  
  5756                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5757                                  
  5758                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5759                                  ; module name: remap
  5760                                  ;
  5761                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5762                                  ;
  5763                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5764                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5765                                  ;
  5766                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5767                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5768                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5769                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5770                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5771                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5772                                  
  5773                                  ; input:       none
  5774                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5775                                  ; exit error:  none
  5776                                  ; called from: msinit
  5777                                  ;
  5778                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5779                                  ;	  found in the system
  5780                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5781                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5782                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5783                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5784                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5785                                  ;
  5786                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5787                                  
  5788                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5789                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5790                                  
  5791                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5792 00001C77 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5793                                  
  5794                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5795                                  
  5796                                  drive_loop:				
  5797 00001C7C 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5798                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5799 00001C80 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5800 00001C82 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5801                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5802 00001C84 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5803 00001C87 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5804 00001C89 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5805                                  
  5806                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5807                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5808                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5809                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5810                                  
  5811                                  fdrv_found:				
  5812 00001C8B B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5813                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5814 00001C8D 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5815                                  					; found	??
  5816 00001C90 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5817                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5818                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5819                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5820 00001C92 40                      		inc	ax
  5821 00001C93 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  5822 00001C96 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  5823                                  
  5824                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5825                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5826                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5827                                  ; any more.
  5828                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5829                                  
  5830 00001C98 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5831                                  					; get first bds
  5832 00001C9D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5833                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  5834 00001C9F 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  5835 00001CA4 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  5836                                  remap_loop1:				
  5837 00001CA7 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5838                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  5839 00001CA9 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5840 00001CAC FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  5841 00001CAE FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  5842 00001CB0 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  5843                                  
  5844                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  5845                                  
  5846 00001CB2 2EA0[CA16]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  5847 00001CB6 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  5848 00001CB8 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  5849 00001CBA 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  5850 00001CBF 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  5851                                  
  5852                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  5853                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  5854                                  
  5855 00001CC1 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  5856 00001CC3 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  5857                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5858                                  
  5859                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  5860                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  5861                                  
  5862                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  5863 00001CC5 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  5864                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  5865 00001CCA 2EA2[CA16]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  5866 00001CCE FEC0                    		inc	al
  5867 00001CD0 1E                      		push	ds
  5868 00001CD1 BF5804                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5869                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  5870 00001CD4 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  5871 00001CD6 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  5872                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  5873                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  5874 00001CD9 1F                      		pop	ds
  5875                                  rmap_exit:				
  5876 00001CDA C3                      		retn
  5877                                  
  5878                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5879                                  
  5880                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5881                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  5882                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  5883                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  5884                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  5885                                  ;**************************************************
  5886                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  5887                                  ;
  5888                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  5889                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  5890                                  ;
  5891                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  5892                                  ;**************************************************
  5893                                  
  5894                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5895                                  bootbias equ 200h
  5896                                  
  5897                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  5898                                  		
  5899                                  		; 08/04/2018
  5900                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  5901                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  5902                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5903                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  5904                                  
  5905 00001CDB 2EA1[D516]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  5906 00001CDF 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  5907                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5908 00001CE1 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  5909                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  5910                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  5911 00001CE4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5912 00001CE7 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  5913 00001CE9 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  5914 00001CEC CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5915                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5916                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5917                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5918 00001CEE 7209                    		jb	short erret
  5919                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5920 00001CF0 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  5921                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  5922                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  5923 00001CF7 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  5924                                  erret:					
  5925 00001CF9 F9                      		stc
  5926                                  norm_ret:				
  5927 00001CFA C3                      		retn
  5928                                  
  5929                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5930                                  
  5931                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  5932                                  
  5933                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5934                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  5935                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  5936                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  5937                                  ;   determine version number
  5938                                  ;
  5939                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  5940                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  5941                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  5942                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  5943                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  5944                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  5945                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  5946                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5947                                  
  5948                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  5949 00001CFB 57                      		push	di
  5950 00001CFC 53                      		push	bx
  5951 00001CFD 1E                      		push	ds
  5952 00001CFE 06                      		push	es
  5953 00001CFF 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5954 00001D02 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5955 00001D05 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  5956                                  					; fnon_removable
  5957 00001D09 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  5958                                  					; ffHardFile
  5959 00001D0D C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  5960 00001D12 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  5961 00001D14 52                      		push	dx
  5962 00001D15 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5963 00001D17 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5964                                  					; DL = drive number
  5965                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5966                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5967                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5968 00001D19 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  5969 00001D1B 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  5970 00001D1E 5A                      		pop	dx
  5971 00001D1F 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  5972 00001D21 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  5973 00001D24 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5974 00001D27 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  5975 00001D28 E8B0FF                  		call	getboot
  5976 00001D2B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  5977 00001D2C 7256                    		jb	short setret
  5978 00001D2E BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  5979                                  
  5980                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  5981                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  5982                                  
  5983                                  act_part:				
  5984 00001D31 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  5985 00001D36 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  5986 00001D38 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  5987 00001D3C 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5988 00001D3E 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  5989 00001D42 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5990 00001D44 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  5991 00001D48 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  5992                                  got_good_act:				
  5993 00001D4A 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  5994 00001D4C 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  5995 00001D4E FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  5996                                  no_act:					
  5997 00001D50 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  5998 00001D53 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  5999                                  					; last entry done?
  6000 00001D57 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6001 00001D59 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6002                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6003                                  
  6004                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6005                                  
  6006                                  get_primary:				
  6007 00001D5C 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6008 00001D61 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6009                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6010 00001D63 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6011 00001D67 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6012 00001D69 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6013 00001D6D 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6014 00001D6F 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6015 00001D73 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6016                                  got_prim:				
  6017 00001D75 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6018 00001D77 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6019 00001D79 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6020                                  not_prim:				
  6021 00001D7B 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6022 00001D7E 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6023 00001D82 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6024                                  setret:					
  6025 00001D84 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6026 00001D85 E9E002                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6027                                  
  6028                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6029                                  
  6030                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6031                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6032                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6033                                  ;
  6034                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6035                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6036                                  ;  without change.
  6037                                  ;
  6038                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6039                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6040                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6041                                  
  6042                                  set2:					
  6043 00001D88 2E8816[D716]            		mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6044                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6045 00001D8D 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6046 00001D91 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6047                                  
  6048                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6049                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6050

  6135                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6136                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6137                                  
  6138                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6139                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.

  6142 00001E2B 07                      		pop	es

  6144                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot	sector
  6145                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6146 00001E2F B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6147 00001E32 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6148                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6149                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6150                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6151                                  
  6152                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6153                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6154                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6155

  6157 00001E37 53                      		push	bx
  6158 00001E38 50                      		push	ax
  6159 00001E39 2E803FE9                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6160 00001E3D 740D                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6161 00001E3F 2E803FEB                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6162 00001E43 7529                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6163 00001E45 2E807F0290              		cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6164 00001E4A 7522                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record

  6167                                  					; point	to the bpb in the boot record

  6169                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte

  6171 00001E55 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6172 00001E57 7515                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no,	invalid	boot record
  6173 00001E59 2E813F0002              		cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6174 00001E5E 750E                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6175                                  
  6176                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6177 00001E60 2E8A4702                		mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure	that
  6178                                  					; the sectorspercluster	is
  6179                                  					; a power of 2
  6180                                  					;
  6181                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]

  6419                                  		;or	cx, ax		; see if it is a big zero
  6420                                  		;jz	short totsec_already_set ; screw it. it	was bogus.
  6421                                  copy_totsec:				
  6422 00001F31 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6423                                  					; make DPB match boot sec
  6424 00001F34 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6425                                  
  6426                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6427                                  ;totsec_already_set:			
  6428                                  		;mov	ax, [di+1Bh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6429                                  		;mov	dx, [di+1Dh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6430                                  
  6431                                  ; determine fat entry size.
  6432                                  
  6433                                  fat_big_small:
  6434                                  
  6435                                  ;at this moment dx;ax = total sector number
  6436                                  
  6437                                  ;Do not assume 1 reserved sector. Update the reserved sector field in BDS 
  6438                                  ;from the BPB on the disk
  6439

  6441                                  					; get #reserved_sectors	from BPB

  6443                                  					; update BDS field

  6445 00001F40 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; update the count
  6446 00001F43 2E8B5C0B                		mov	bx, [cs:si+0Bh]	; [cs:si+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  6447                                  					; bx = sectors/fat
  6448 00001F47 895D11                  		mov	[di+11h], bx	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6449                                  					; set in bds bpb
  6450                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6451                                  		; (number of FATs optimization)

  6454                                  		; 18/12/2022

  6457                                  		;shl	bx, 1	; =*?=	; always 2 fats

  6460 00001F4F 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0

  6462                                  					; # root entries

  6464                                  					; set in bds bpb

  6466 00001F5B D3EB                    		shr	bx, cl		; div by 16 ents/sector
  6467 00001F5D 29D8                    		sub	ax, bx		; sub #	dir sectors
  6468 00001F5F 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		;
  6469                                  					; dx:ax	now contains the
  6470                                  					; # of data sectors
  6471 00001F62 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx ; *
  6472 00001F64 2E8A4C02                		mov	cl, [cs:si+2]	; [cs:si+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6473                                  					; sectors per cluster
  6474 00001F68 884D08                  		mov	[di+8],	cl	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  6475                                  					; set in bios bpb
  6476 00001F6B 50                      		push	ax
  6477 00001F6C 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6478 00001F6E 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6479 00001F70 F7F1                    		div	cx		; cx = sectors per cluster
  6480 00001F72 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax	; [temp_h]:ax now contains the
  6481                                  					; # clusters.
  6482 00001F76 58                      		pop	ax
  6483 00001F77 F7F1                    		div	cx
  6484 00001F79 2E833E[2905]00          		cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6485 00001F7F 771C                    		ja	short toobig_ret ; too big cluster number
  6486 00001F81 3DF60F                  		cmp	ax, 0FF6h	; 4096-10
  6487                                  					; is this 16-bit fat?
  6488 00001F84 7205                    		jb	short copymediaid ; no,	small fat
  6489                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6490 00001F86 800E[D216]40            		or	byte [fbigfat], 40h
  6491                                  		;or	ds:fbigfat, 40h	; fbig
  6492                                  					; 16 bit fat
  6493                                  copymediaid:

  6495 00001F8C 1E                      		push	ds
  6496 00001F8D 07                      		pop	es

  6498 00001F8F 1F                      		pop	ds

  6516                                  					; but useless. to big for
  6517                                  					; current pc dos fat file system

  6536                                  scan:

  6548                                  gotparm:

  6554                                  					; cl = log base	2 of ch

  6564                                  					; save sectors per cluster
  6565                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6566 00001FE0 F606[D216]40            		test	byte [fbigfat], 40h
  6567                                  		;test	ds:fbigfat, 40h	; fbig
  6568                                  					; if (fbigfat)
  6569 00001FE5 751E                    		jnz	short dobig	; goto dobig; (16 bit fat)
  6570                                  
  6571                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is gauranteed
  6572                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6573                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6574                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  6575                                  
  6576 00001FE7 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; (12 bit fat)
  6577 00001FE9 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch
  6578 00001FEB 4B                      		dec	bx
  6579 00001FEC 01C3                    		add	bx, ax		; dx=0
  6580 00001FEE D3EB                    		shr	bx, cl		; bx = 1+(bpb->maxsec+BDS.secperclus-1)/
  6581 00001FF0 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus
  6582 00001FF1 80E3FE                  		and	bl, 0FEh	; bx &= ~1; (=number of clusters)
  6583 00001FF4 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
  6584 00001FF6 D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1
  6585 00001FF8 01F3                    		add	bx, si
  6586 00001FFA 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  6587 00001FFE D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)
  6588 00002000 887D11                  		mov	[di+11h], bh	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6589                                  					; save number of fat sectors
  6590 00002003 EB3D                    		jmp	short massage_bpb
  6591                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6592                                  
  6593                                  ; for bigfat we do need to extend this logic to 32 bit sector calculation.
  6594                                  
  6595                                  dobig:					
  6596 00002005 B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  6597 00002007 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  6598 00002008 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  6599 0000200B D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  6600 0000200D 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  6601 0000200F 5A                      		pop	dx
  6602 00002010 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  6603 00002013 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6604 00002016 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  6605                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  6606 00002019 B302                    		mov	bl, 2
  6607 0000201B 8A7D08                  		mov	bh, [di+8]	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  6608                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  6609                                  
  6610                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  6611                                  
  6612                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  6613                                  		; 27/09/2022
  6614                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  6615                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  6616                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  6617                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6618                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6619                                  		; (If FATType == FAT16,	BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz))
  6620                                  		
  6621 0000201E 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+2
  6622 00002020 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  6623 00002023 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+1
  6624 00002026 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6625                                  
  6626                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  6627                                  
  6628 00002029 F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  6629                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  6630 0000202B 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6631                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  6632                                  
  6633                                  ; now, set the default filesys_id, volume label, serial number
  6634                                  
  6635                                  		;mov	bl, ds:fbigfat
  6636                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6637 0000202E 8A1E[D216]              		mov	bl, [fbigfat]
  6638 00002032 885D1F                  		mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz] ; fat	size flag
  6639                                  
  6640 00002035 1E                      		push	ds
  6641 00002036 1E                      		push	ds
  6642 00002037 07                      		pop	es
  6643 00002038 0E                      		push	cs
  6644 00002039 1F                      		pop	ds
  6645                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6646 0000203A BD[CC05]                		mov	bp, CLEARIDS
  6647                                  		;mov	bp, 5D9h	; clear_ids
  6648                                  					; at 2C7h:5D9h = 70h:2B49h
  6649 0000203D 0E                      		push	cs
  6650 0000203E E824F7                  		call	call_bios_code
  6651 00002041 1F                      		pop	ds
  6652                                  
  6653                                  ; at this point, in bpb of bds table, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS which is
  6654                                  ; set according to the partition information. we are going to
  6655                                  ; see if (hidden sectors + total sectors) > a word. if it is true,
  6656                                  ; then no change. otherwise, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be moved
  6657                                  ; to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be set to 0.
  6658                                  ; we don't do this for the bpb information from the boot record. we
  6659                                  ; are not going to change the bpb information from the boot record.
  6660                                  
  6661                                  massage_bpb:
  6662                                  		; 12/12/2022
  6663 00002042 8A1E[D216]              		mov	bl, [fbigfat]
  6664 00002046 885D1F                  		mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz]
  6665                                  					; set size of fat on media
  6666                                  		;
  6667 00002049 8B551D                  		mov	dx, [di+1Dh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6668 0000204C 8B451B                  		mov	ax, [di+1Bh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6669 0000204F 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0		; double word total sectors?
  6670                                  		;ja	short goodret	; don't have to change it.
  6671                                  		; 12/12/2022
  6672 00002052 7714                    		ja	short short goodret2
  6673                                  		;cmp	word [di+19h], 0 ; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6674                                  		;ja	short goodret	; don't have to change it.
  6675                                  		; 12/12/2022

  6706                                  ; 15/10/2022
  6707                                  
  6708                                  ;fdisk of pc dos 3.3 and below, os2 1.0 has a bug. the maximum number of
  6709                                  ;sector that can be handled by pc dos 3.3 ibmbio should be 0ffffh.
  6710                                  ;instead, sometimes fdisk use 10000h to calculate the maximum number.
  6711                                  ;so, we are going to check that if BPB_TOTALSECTORS + hidden sector = 10000h
  6712                                  ;then subtract 1 from BPB_TOTALSECTORS.

  6754                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6755                                  
  6756                                  ; 15/10/2022
  6757                                  
  6758                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  6759                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  6760                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  6761                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.
  6762                                  ;
  6763                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
  6764                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
  6765                                  
  6766                                  setdrvparms:
  6767 000020B3 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6768                                  		; 18/10/2022
  6769 000020B5 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds in list
  6770                                  _next_bds:				
  6771 000020B9 06                      		push	es
  6772 000020BA 57                      		push	di
  6773 000020BB 268A5D22                		mov	bl, [es:di+22h]	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
  6774 000020BF 80FB05                  		cmp	bl, 5		; ffHardFile
  6775 000020C2 753E                    		jnz	short nothardff
  6776 000020C4 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6777 000020C6 268B450E                		mov	ax, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
  6778 000020CA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  6779 000020CC 7508                    		jnz	short get_ccyl
  6780 000020CE 268B551D                		mov	dx, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6781 000020D2 268B451B                		mov	ax, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6782                                  
  6783                                  get_ccyl:				
  6784 000020D6 52                      		push	dx
  6785 000020D7 50                      		push	ax
  6786 000020D8 268B4515                		mov	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
  6787 000020DC 26F76513                		mul	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6788                                  					; assume sectors per cyl. < 64k.
  6789 000020E0 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax		; cx has # sectors per cylinder
  6790 000020E2 58                      		pop	ax
  6791 000020E3 5A                      		pop	dx		; dx:ax	= total	sectors
  6792 000020E4 50                      		push	ax
  6793 000020E5 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6794 000020E7 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6795 000020E9 F7F1                    		div	cx
  6796 000020EB 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax	; ax be	0 here.
  6797 000020EF 58                      		pop	ax

  6799 000020F2 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
  6800 000020F4 7401                    		jz	short no_cyl_rnd ; came out even
  6801 000020F6 40                      		inc	ax		; round	up
  6802

  6804 000020F7 26894525                		mov	[es:di+25h], ax	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]

  6808                                  					; ds:si	-> bpb for hard	file
  6809 00002100 EB51                    		jmp	short set_recbpb

  6812                                  nothardff:

  6814 00002103 1F                      		pop	ds
  6815                                  
  6816                                  ; if fake floppy drive variable is set then we don't have to handle this bds.
  6817                                  ; we can just go and deal with the next bds at label go_to_next_bds.

  6823                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1

  6831 00002115 F76536                  		mul	word [di+36h]	; [di+BDS.rheads]

  6833 0000211B 89452F                  		mov	[di+2Fh], ax	; [di+BDS.rtotalsecs16]
  6834                                  					; have the total number of sectors
  6835 0000211E 48                      		dec	ax
  6836 0000211F B201                    		mov	dl, 1
  6837                                  _again:					
  6838 00002121 3DF60F                  		cmp	ax, 0FF6h	; 4096-10
  6839 00002124 7206                    		jb	short _@@

  6841 00002128 D0E2                    		shl	dl, 1
  6842 0000212A EBF5                    		jmp	short _again
  6843                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6844                                  
  6845                                  _@@:					
  6846 0000212C 80FA01                  		cmp	dl, 1		; is it	a small	disk ?
  6847 0000212F 7405                    		jz	short __@@	; yes, 224 root	entries	is enuf
  6848 00002131 C7452DF000              		mov	word [di+2Dh], 240 ; [di+BDS.rdirentries]
  6849                                  __@@:					
  6850 00002136 885529                  		mov	[di+29h], dl	; [di+BDS.rsecperclus]
  6851                                  
  6852                                  ; logic to get the sectors/fat area.
  6853                                  ; fat entry is assumed to be 1.5 bytes!!!
  6854                                  
  6855                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6856                                  		; ds = cs
  6857                                  		; 17/10/2022 (ds=cs)
  6858 00002139 F726[AF20]              		mul	word [word3]
  6859 0000213D F736[AD20]              		div	word [word2]
  6860 00002141 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6861 00002143 F736[B120]              		div	word [word512]
  6862                                  		;
  6863                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6864                                  		;mul	word [cs:word3]	; * 3 ; mul word [cs:word3]
  6865                                  		;div	word [cs:word2]	; / 2 ; div word [cs:word2]
  6866                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  6867                                  		;div	word [cs:word512] ; / 512 ; div word [cs:word512]
  6868                                  		;
  6869 00002147 40                      		inc	ax		; + 1
  6870                                  no_round_up:

  6872 0000214B EB0E                    		jmp	short go_to_next_bds

  6877                                  		;mov	si, bpbtable
  6878                                  		;mov	si, [bpbtable+bx] ; 15/10/2022
  6879                                  		; 09/12/2022
  6880                                  		;mov	si, BPBTABLE
  6881                                  		;mov	si, [bx+si]	; get address of bpb
  6882                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6883                                  		;mov	si, [BPBTABLE+bx]
  6884                                  		; 13/12/2022
  6885 0000214F 8BB7[9051]              		mov	si, [SYSINITOFFSET+bpbtable+bx]
  6886                                  set_recbpb:

  6888                                  					; es:di	-> recbpb
  6889 00002156 B91900                  		mov	cx, 25		; bpbx.size
  6890 00002159 F3A4                    		rep movsb		; move (size bpbx) bytes

  6894 0000215D 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
  6895 00002160 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; -1
  6896 00002163 740A                    		jz	short got_end_of_bds_chain
  6897 00002165 E951FF                  		jmp	_next_bds

  6946                                  
  6947                                  ; domini **********************************************************************
  6948                                  ;
  6949                                  ;mini disk initialization routine. called right after dohard
  6950                                  ;modified for >2 hardfile support
  6951                                  ;
  6952                                  ; **cs=ds=es=datagrp
  6953                                  ;
  6954                                  ; **domini will search for every extended partition in the system, and
  6955                                  ;   initialize it.
  6956                                  ;
  6957                                  ; **bdsm stands for bds table for mini disk and located right after the label
  6958                                  ;   end96tpi. end_of_bdsm will have the offset value of the ending
  6959                                  ;   address of bdsm table.
  6960                                  ;
  6961                                  ; **bdsm is the same as usual bds structure except that tim_lo, tim_hi entries
  6962                                  ;   are overlapped and used to identify mini disk and the number of hidden_trks.
  6963                                  ;   right now, they are called as ismini, hidden_trks respectively.
  6964                                  ;
  6965                                  ; **domini will use the same routine in sethard routine after label set2 to
  6966                                  ;   save coding.
  6967                                  ;
  6968                                  ; **drvmax determined in dohard routine will be used for the next
  6969                                  ;   available logical mini disk drive number.
  6970                                  ;
  6971                                  ; input: drvmax, dskdrvs
  6972                                  ;
  6973                                  ; output: minidisk installed. bdsm table established and installed to bds.
  6974                                  ;	  end_of_bdsm - ending offset address of bdsm.
  6975                                  ;
  6976                                  ; called modules:
  6977                                  ;		  getboot
  6978                                  ;		  find_mini_partition (new), xinstall_bds (new), M038
  6979                                  ;
  6980                                  ;		  setmini (new, it will use set2 routine)
  6981                                  ;
  6982                                  ; variables used: end_of_bdsm
  6983                                  ;		  rom_minidisk_num
  6984                                  ;		  mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  6985                                  ;		  BDS_STRUC, start_bds
  6986                                  ;
  6987                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6988                                  
  6989                                  		; 19/10/2022
  6990                                  domini:	
  6991 00002179 8A36[5117]              		mov	dh, [hnum]	; get number of hardfiles
  6992                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6993 0000217D 20F6                    		and	dh, dh
  6994                                  		;cmp	dh, 0
  6995 0000217F 7431                    		jz	short dominiret	; no hard file?	then exit.
  6996 00002181 B280                    		mov	dl, 80h		; start	with hardfile 80h
  6997                                  domini_loop:				
  6998 00002183 52                      		push	dx
  6999 00002184 8816[5017]              		mov	[rom_minidisk_num], dl
  7000 00002188 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  7001 0000218A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7002                                  					; DL = drive number
  7003                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  7004                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  7005                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  7006 0000218C FEC6                    		inc	dh
  7007 0000218E 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  7008 00002190 88F0                    		mov	al, dh
  7009 00002192 A3[5617]                		mov	[mini_hdlim], ax ; # of heads
  7010 00002195 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  7011 00002198 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
