  9405                                  
  9406                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9407                                  
  9408                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9409                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9410                                  ; drive.
  9411                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9412                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9413                                  ; returns in si:
  9414                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9415                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9416                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9417                                  ;
  9418                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9419                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9420                                  
  9421                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9422                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9423 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9424 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9425 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9426                                  					; get stored time
  9427 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9428 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9429 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9430 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9431 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9432 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9433 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9434 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9435                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9436 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9437 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9438 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9439                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9440                                  
  9441                                  timepassed:				
  9442 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9443                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9444 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9445                                  
  9446                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9447                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9448 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9449                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9450 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9451                                  
  9452                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9453                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9454                                  Err_Exitj2:
  9455 00000583 EBC8                    		jmp	short err_exitj
  9456                                  
  9457                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9458                                  
  9459                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9460                                  
  9461                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9462                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.
  9463                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9464                                  
  9465                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9466                                  get_bpb:				; 2C7h:592h = 70h:2B02h

  9470                                  					; fnon_removable

  9479 0000059A E85A00                  		call	GetBp		; build	a bpb if necessary
  9480 0000059D 72B1                    		jb	short ret81
  9481                                  		;cmp	ds:set_id_flag,	2 ; already, volume_label set from boot
  9482 0000059F 803E[0A05]02            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 2
  9483                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 ; record to bds table?
  9484 000005A4 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9485 000005A9 740A                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; do not set it again from	root dir
  9486                                  					; otherwise, conventional boot record
  9487                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	; do we	have changeline	support?
  9488 000005AB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9489 000005B0 7403                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; brif not
  9490 000005B2 E86113                  		call	set_volume_id
  9491                                  already_gotbpb:

  9494                                  
  9495                                  ;		 fall into setptrsav, es:di -> result
  9496

  9500                                  
  9501                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9502                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
  9503                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
  9504                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
  9505                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
  9506                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data. 
  9507                                  ;NB: It is fine to corrupt cx because this is not a return value and anyway

  9527                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------

  9580                                  
  9581                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9582                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9583                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9584                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9585                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9586                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9587                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9588                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9589                                  ;
  9590                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9591                                  ;
  9592                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9593                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9594                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9595                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9596                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9597                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9598                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9599                                  ;
  9600                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9601                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9602                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9603                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9604                                  
  9605                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9606                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9607 000005F7 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
  9608 000005FC 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
  9609 000005FE E99500                  		jmp	getret_exit
  9610                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9611                                  
  9612                                  getbp1:					
  9613 00000601 51                      		push	cx
  9614 00000602 52                      		push	dx
  9615 00000603 53                      		push	bx
  9616                                  
  9617                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
  9618                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
  9619                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
  9620                                  
  9621 00000604 E8A400                  		call	readbootsec
  9622 00000607 7209                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.
  9623 00000609 09DB                    		or	bx, bx		; bx is	0 if boot sector is valid.
  9624 0000060B 7508                    		jnz	short dofatbpb
  9625 0000060D E8F000                  		call	movbpb		; move bpb into	registers
  9626 00000610 EB57                    		jmp	short Has1
  9627                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9628                                  
  9629                                  getbp_err_ret_brdg:			
  9630 00000612 E98200                  		jmp	getbp_err_ret
  9631                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9632                                  
  9633                                  		; we have a 1.x diskette. In this case read in the fat ID byte
  9634                                  		; and fill in bpb from there.
  9635                                  dofatbpb:				
  9636 00000615 E85401                  		call	readfat		; puts media descriptor	byte in	ah
  9637 00000618 72F8                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg
  9638                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	;  changeline support available?
  9639 0000061A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; 19/10/2022
  9640 0000061F 7403                    		jz	short bpb_nochangeline ; brif not
  9641 00000621 E88D12                  		call	hidensity	; may not return! May add sp, 2	and
  9642                                  					; jump to has1!!!!!! or	has720K

  9645                                  					; ffSmall

  9647 0000062B 80FCF9                  		cmp	ah, 0F9h	; is it	a valid	fat id byte for	3.5" ?
  9648 0000062E 7571                    		jnz	short got_unknown_medium

  9654                                  		; to get spf,csec,spau,spt correctly. it had been wrong if
  9655                                  		; driver.sys is loaded since the bds is inside the driver.sys.

  9664                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
  9665                                  		;db	8Ah, 87h, 0, 0	; mov al, [bx+0]
  9666                                  		;db	8Bh, 8Fh, 3, 0	; mov cx, [bx+3]
  9667                                  		;db	8Bh, 97h, 5, 0	; mov dx, [bx+5]

  9745                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9746                                  
  9747                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9748                                  
  9749                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9750                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9751                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9752                                  ;
  9753                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9754                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9755                                  
  9756                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9757                                  
  9758                                  readbootsec:	
  9759 000006AB B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9760 000006AD B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9761 000006B0 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9762 000006B3 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9763 000006B5 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9764                                  
  9765                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9766                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9767                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9768                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9769                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9770                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9771                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9772                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9773                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9774                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9775                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9776                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9777                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9778                                  		; informations
  9779                                  
  9780                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9781                                  
  9782                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9783 000006B7 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9784 000006BC 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9785 000006BE 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9786 000006C3 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9787 000006C5 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9788 000006CA 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9789 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9790 000006D1 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9791                                  
  9792                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9793                                  ;
  9794                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9795                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9796                                  ;;
  9797                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9798                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9799                                  ;;
  9800                                  ;;check_signature:
  9801                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9802                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9803                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9804                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9805                                  
  9806                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9807                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9808                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9809                                  
  9810                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9811                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9812 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9813                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9814 000006D6 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9815 000006D8 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9816 000006DA 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9817                                  
  9818                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9819                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9820                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9821                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9822                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9823                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9824                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9825                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9826                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9827                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9828                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9829                                  
  9830                                  checksinglesided:
  9831 000006DC A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9832 000006DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9833 000006E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9834 000006E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9835 000006E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9836 000006E7 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9837 000006ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9838 000006EF 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9839 000006F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9840                                  
  9841                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9842                                  
  9843                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9844 000006F6 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9845                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9846 000006FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9847                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9848                                  
  9849                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9850 000006FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9851                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9852                                  movbpb_ret:
  9853                                  gooddsk:				
  9854 000006FE F8                      		clc
  9855                                  err_ret:
  9856 000006FF C3                      		retn
  9857                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9858                                  
  9859                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9860                                  ;err_ret:				
  9861                                  		;retn
  9862                                  
  9863                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9864                                  
  9865                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9866                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9867                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
  9868                                  ; getbp routine at has1
  9869                                  ;
  9870                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
  9871                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
  9872                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
  9873                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
  9874                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
  9875                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
  9876                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9877                                  
  9878                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9879                                  
  9880                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9881                                  movbpb:	
  9882 00000700 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
  9883                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9884                                  					; sectors per unit
  9885 00000704 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
  9886                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  9887                                  					; number of directory entries
  9888 00000708 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
  9889                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  9890                                  					; size of drive
  9891 0000070C 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
  9892                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9893                                  					; media	descriptor
  9894 00000710 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
  9895                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  9896                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9897 00000713 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
  9898                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
  9899                                  					; sectors per track
  9900 00000717 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
  9901                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
  9902                                  					; number of heads
  9903 0000071B 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
  9904 00000720 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9905 00000722 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
  9906 00000725 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
  9907 00000727 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
  9908                                  movbpb_conv:				
  9909 0000072C 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
  9910 00000731 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9911 00000733 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
  9912                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9913                                  		; cf = 0
  9914                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
  9915                                  		;clc
  9916 00000736 C3                      		retn
  9917                                  
  9918                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9919                                  
  9920                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
  9921                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
  9922                                  ;by es:di.
  9923                                  
  9924                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
  9925                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
  9926                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
  9927                                  ;      the boot record information.
  9928                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
  9929                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
  9930                                  
  9931                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9932                                  mov_media_ids:		
  9933 00000737 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
  9934                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
  9935                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
  9936 0000073C 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
  9937 0000073E 51                      		push	cx
  9938 0000073F 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
  9939                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
  9940 00000743 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9941 00000747 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
  9942                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
  9943 0000074B 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
  9944 0000074F 57                      		push	di
  9945 00000750 56                      		push	si
  9946 00000751 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9947 00000754 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
  9948                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
  9949                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
  9950 00000757 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
  9951 0000075A F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9952                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
  9953                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9954 0000075C B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
  9955 0000075E BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
  9956                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
  9957 00000761 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9958 00000764 F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9959 00000766 5E                      		pop	si
  9960 00000767 5F                      		pop	di
  9961 00000768 59                      		pop	cx
  9962                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9963                                  		; cf = 0
  9964                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
  9965                                  				; (20/09/2022)
  9966 00000769 C3                      		retn
  9967                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9968                                  
  9969                                  mmi_not_ext:				
  9970 0000076A F9                      		stc
  9971 0000076B C3                      		retn
  9972                                  
  9973                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9974                                  
  9975                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9976                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
  9977                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
  9978                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
  9979                                  ; output:
  9980                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
  9981                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
  9982                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
  9983                                  
  9984                                  readfat:	
  9985                                  		;mov	dh, 0
  9986                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9987 0000076C 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  9988 0000076E B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
  9989                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
  9990 00000771 E80500                  		call	read_sector
  9991 00000774 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
  9992 00000776 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
  9993                                  bad_fat_ret:				
  9994 00000778 C3                      		retn
  9995                                  
  9996                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9997                                  
  9998                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9999                                  
 10000                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10001                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10002                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10003                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10004                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10005                                  ;		dh has head
 10006                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10007                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10008                                  ;
 10009                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10010                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10011                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10012                                  ;
 10013                                  ;		carry set
 10014                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10015                                  ;
 10016                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10017                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10018                                  
 10019                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10020                                  
 10021                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10022                                  read_sector:	
 10023 00000779 55                      		push	bp
 10024 0000077A BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10025 0000077D 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10026 00000781 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10027                                  rd_ret:					
 10028 00000784 06                      		push	es
 10029 00000785 1E                      		push	ds
 10030 00000786 07                      		pop	es
 10031 00000787 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10032 0000078A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10033                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10034                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10035                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10036 0000078C 07                      		pop	es
 10037 0000078D 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10038                                  rd_rty:					
 10039 0000078F E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10040 00000792 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10041 00000794 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10042                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10043                                  					; fnon_removable
 10044 00000799 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10045 0000079B 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10046 000007A0 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10047 000007A2 50                      		push	ax
 10048 000007A3 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10049 000007A4 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10050                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10051                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10052                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10053                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10054 000007A8 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10055 000007AA 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10056                                  		; 
 10057 000007AD 1F                      		pop	ds
 10058 000007AE A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10059 000007B1 58                      		pop	ax
 10060                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10061 000007B2 06                      		push	es
 10062 000007B3 1E                      		push	ds
 10063 000007B4 07                      		pop	es
 10064 000007B5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10065 000007B8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10066                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10067                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10068                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10069 000007BA 07                      		pop	es
 10070 000007BB 9C                      		pushf
 10071 000007BC 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10072 000007C1 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10073 000007C3 50                      		push	ax
 10074 000007C4 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10075 000007C7 1E                      		push	ds
 10076 000007C8 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10077 000007CC 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10078 000007CF 1F                      		pop	ds
 10079 000007D0 58                      		pop	ax
 10080                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10081 000007D1 9D                      		popf
 10082 000007D2 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10083 000007D4 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10084                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10085                                  
 10086                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10087 000007D6 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10088                                  					; return error
 10089 000007D8 F9                      		stc
 10090                                  
 10091                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10092                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10093                                  
 10094                                  okret2:					
 10095 000007D9 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10096 000007DD 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10097 000007E1 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10098                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10099                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10100 000007E5 9C                      		pushf
 10101 000007E6 E8FF03                  		call	set_tim
 10102 000007E9 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10103 000007EA 5D                      		pop	bp
 10104 000007EB C3                      		retn
 10105                                  
 10106                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 10110                                  dsk_open:				; 2C7h:80Ah = 70h:2D7Ah

 10132                                  		; cf = 0
 10133                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10134                                  				; (19/07/2019 -	Erdogan	Tan - MSDOS 6.0	IO.SYS - retrodos4.s)
 10135 00000810 C3                      		retn

 10194                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10195                                  
 10196                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10197                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10198                                  
 10199                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10200                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10201                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10202                                  
 10203                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10204                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10205                                  ;
 10206                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10207                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10208                                  
 10209                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10210                                  checksingle:		
 10211 0000083B 50                      		push	ax
 10212 0000083C 53                      		push	bx
 10213 0000083D 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10214                                  
 10215                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10216                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10217                                  
 10218 00000841 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10219 00000844 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10220 00000846 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10221                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10222 00000849 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10223                                  
 10224                                  
 10225                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10226                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10227                                  
 10228 0000084B 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10229                                  					; get physical drive number
 10230 0000084F 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10231 00000850 57                      		push	di
 10232 00000851 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10233                                  scan_list:				
 10234 00000855 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10235 00000859 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10236 0000085B B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10237 0000085D 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10238 00000861 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10239 00000863 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10240 00000867 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10241 00000868 07                      		pop	es
 10242 00000869 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10243                                  
 10244                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10245                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10246                                  ; in this case.
 10247 0000086D 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10248 00000872 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10249                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10250 00000874 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10251 00000879 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10252 0000087B 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10253                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10254                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10255 0000087F 06                      		push	es
 10256 00000880 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10257 00000884 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10258                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10259                                  					; set up sdsb
 10260 00000888 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10261 00000889 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10262                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10263                                  
 10264                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10265                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10266                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10267                                  
 10268                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10269 0000088B 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10270 00000890 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10271 00000892 50                      		push	ax
 10272 00000893 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10273 00000897 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10274 00000899 06                      		push	es
 10275 0000089A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10276 0000089E 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10277                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10278                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10279 000008A3 07                      		pop	es
 10280 000008A4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10281 000008A6 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10282 000008A7 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10283                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10284 000008A9 E8800E                  		call	swpdsk
 10285 000008AC EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10286                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10287                                  
 10288                                  scan_skip:	
 10289 000008AE 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10290                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10291                                  					; go to	next bds
 10292 000008B1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10293 000008B4 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10294 000008B6 F9                      		stc
 10295 000008B7 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10296 000008B8 07                      		pop	es
 10297                                  
 10298                                  singleret:				
 10299 000008B9 5B                      		pop	bx
 10300 000008BA 58                      		pop	ax
 10301 000008BB C3                      		retn
 10302

 10304                                  
 10305                                  baddrive:				
 10306 000008BC B008                    		mov	al, 8		; sector not found
 10307 000008BE EB02                    		jmp	short baddrive_ret
 10308                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10309                                  
 10310                                  unformatteddrive:				
 10311 000008C0 B007                    		mov	al, 7		; unknown media
 10312                                  baddrive_ret:

 10315                                  
 10316                                  ioret:		
 10317 000008C3 C3                      		retn
 10318                                  
 10319                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10320                                  
 10321                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10322                                  
 10323                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10324                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10325                                  ;
 10326                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10327                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10328                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10329                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10330                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10331                                  ;	ds = cs
 10332                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10333                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10334                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10335                                  ;
 10336                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10337                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10338                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10339                                  
 10340                                  diskrd:	
 10341                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10342                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10343 000008C4 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10344                                  
 10345                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10346                                  
 10347                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10348                                  diskio:
 10349 000008C9 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10350 000008CB 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10351 000008CF E8F9FB                  		call	SetDrive
 10352 000008D2 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10353 000008D6 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10354                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10355 000008D9 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10356                                  
 10357                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10358                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10359                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10360                                  
 10361 000008DB 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10362                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10363                                  					; unformatted_media
 10364 000008E0 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10365 000008E2 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10366 000008E6 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10367                                  
 10368                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10369                                  
 10370 000008EA 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10371 000008EC 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10372 000008EE 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10373 000008F0 83D600                  		adc	si, 0
 10374 000008F3 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10375                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?
 10376 000008F8 740D                    		jz	short sanity32
 10377 000008FA 83FE00                  		cmp	si, 0
 10378 000008FD 75BD                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10379 000008FF 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10380 00000903 77B7                    		ja	short baddrive
 10381 00000905 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10382                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10383                                  
 10384                                  sanity32:				
 10385 00000907 0336[2B05]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10386 0000090B 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10387 0000090F 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10388 00000911 77A9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10389 00000913 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10390 00000917 77A3                    		ja	short baddrive
 10391                                  
 10392                                  sanityok:				
 10393 00000919 8B16[2B05]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10394 0000091D 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10395 00000921 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10396                                  
 10397                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10398                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10399                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10400                                  
 10401 00000925 A3[2D05]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10402                                  
 10403                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10404                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10405                                  
 10406 00000928 06                      		push	es
 10407 00000929 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10408 0000092D 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 10409                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 10410                                  					; current disk parm table
 10411 00000932 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 10412 00000936 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10413 0000093A 07                      		pop	es
 10414 0000093B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10415                                  					; fnon_removable
 10416 00000940 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10417 00000942 E8F6FE                  		call	checksingle
 10418                                  
 10419                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10420                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10421                                  ; the proper error code.
 10422                                  
 10423 00000945 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10424 0000094A 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10425 0000094C E8AB0E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10426                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10427                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10428 0000094F E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10429                                  
 10430                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10431                                  
 10432                                  skip_setup:
 10433                                  
 10434                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10435                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10436                                  				
 10437 00000952 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10438 00000954 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10439 00000956 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10440                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10441 0000095A A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10442 0000095D A1[2D05]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10443 00000960 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10444                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10445                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10446                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10447 00000964 42                      		inc	dx
 10448 00000965 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10449 00000969 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10450                                  					; get number of	heads
 10451 0000096D 50                      		push	ax
 10452 0000096E 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10453 00000970 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder
 10454 00000973 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10455 00000975 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10456 00000978 58                      		pop	ax
 10457 00000979 F7F1                    		div	cx		; now, [temp_h]:ax = cylinder #, dx = head
 10458 0000097B 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
 10459 00000980 7714                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10460 00000982 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024	; 2^10 currently maxium	for track #.
 10461 00000985 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10462 00000987 8816[3201]              		mov	[curhd], dl	; save current head
 10463 0000098B A3[3301]                		mov	[curtrk], ax	; save current track
 10464                                  
 10465                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 10466                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 10467                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.
 10468                                  
 10469 0000098E A1[2201]                		mov	ax, [seccnt]
 10470 00000991 E88400                  		call	block		; (cas - call/ret)
 10471                                  		;call	done
 10472                                  		;retn
 10473                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10474 00000994 EB4B                    		jmp	done
 10475                                  
 10476                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10477                                  
 10478                                  baddrive_brdg:

 10480

 10482                                  
 10483                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10484                                  ; set the drive-last-accessed flag for diskette only. 
 10485                                  ; we know that the hard disk will not be removed.
 10486                                  ; es:di -> current bds.
 10487                                  ; ds -> Bios_Data
 10488                                  ; ax,cx,si are destroyed.
 10489                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10490                                  
 10491                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10492                                  iosetup:	
 10493 00000999 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10494 0000099D A2[1E01]                		mov	[tim_drv], al	; save drive letter
 10495                                  
 10496                                  ; determine proper head settle values
 10497                                  
 10498 000009A0 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10499 000009A5 7539                    		jnz	short skip_dpt_setting
 10500 000009A7 A0[2C01]                		mov	al, [eot]	; fetch	up eot before changing ds
 10501 000009AA 1E                      		push	ds
 10502 000009AB C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10503 000009AF 884404                  		mov	[si+4],	al
 10504 000009B2 8A440A                  		mov	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 10505 000009B5 8A6404                  		mov	ah, [si+4]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_EOT]
 10506 000009B8 1F                      		pop	ds
 10507 000009B9 A2[2601]                		mov	[motorstartup], al
 10508 000009BC 8826[2B01]              		mov	[save_eot], ah
 10509                                  
 10510                                  ; for 3.5" drives, both external as well as on the k09, we need to set the
 10511                                  ; motor start time to 4. this checking for every i/o is going to affect
 10512                                  ; performance across the board, but is necessary!!
 10513                                  
 10514 000009C0 1E                      		push	ds
 10515 000009C1 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10516 000009C5 26807D2202              		cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 2 ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 10517                                  					; ffSmall
 10518 000009CA 7505                    		jnz	short motor_start_ok
 10519 000009CC B004                    		mov	al, 4
 10520 000009CE 86440A                  		xchg	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 10521                                  motor_start_ok:
 10522                                  
 10523                                  ; ds:si now points to disk parameter table.
 10524                                  ; get current settle and set fast settle
 10525

 10531 000009D4 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10532                                  					; get settle and set up	for fast
 10533 000009D7 1F                      		pop	ds
 10534 000009D8 A2[2701]                		mov	[settlecurrent], al
 10535 000009DB B00F                    		mov	al, 15		; NORMSETTLE
 10536                                  					; someone has diddled the settle
 10537 000009DD A2[2801]                		mov	[settleslow], al
 10538                                  skip_dpt_setting:			
 10539 000009E0 C3                      		retn
 10540                                  
 10541                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10542                                  
 10543                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10544                                  ; set time of last access, and reset default values in the dpt.
 10545                                  ;
 10546                                  ;	  note: trashes (at least) si
 10547                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10548                                  
 10549                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10550                                  done:
 10551 000009E1 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10552                                  					; fnon_removable
 10553 000009E6 752F                    		jnz	short ddbx	; do not set for non-removable media
 10554 000009E8 E8FD01                  		call	set_tim
 10555                                  ;diddleback:
 10556                                  ; 09/12/2022
 10557                                  diddle_back:				
 10558 000009EB 9C                      		pushf
 10559 000009EC 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10560 000009F1 7523                    		jnz	short nodiddleback

 10573                                  nodiddleback:

 10577                                  
 10578                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10579                                  
 10580                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10581                                  ;read the number of sectors specified in ax, 
 10582                                  ;handling track boundaries

 10584                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10585

 10587                                  block:

 10595                                  ; we have to go	to the block_floppy below to break up the operation.
 10596

 10603                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10604                                  
 10605                                  block_floppy:
 10606                                  
 10607                                  ; read at most 1 track worth. perform minimization at sector / track
 10608                                  				
 10609 00000A30 268A4D13                		mov	cl, [es:di+19]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
