 12941                                  ; 17/10/2022
 12942                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12943                                  
 12944                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 12945                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 12946                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 12947                                  
 12948                                  win386call:				
 12949 00001340 1E                      		push	ds
 12950 00001341 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 12951                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 12952                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 12953 00001346 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 12954                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 12955 00001348 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 12956 0000134A 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 12957                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 12958 0000134C 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 12959                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12960 0000134E F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 12961                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 12962 00001351 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 12963                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 12964 00001353 8026[CE08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 12965 00001358 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 12966                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12967                                  
 12968                                  Win386Init:	
 12969                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12970 0000135A F6C201                  		test	dl, 1			
 12971                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 12972 0000135D 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 12973                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 12974 0000135F 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 12975                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 12976                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 12977 00001364 891E[9C08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 12978 00001368 8C06[9E08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 12979                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 12980 0000136C BB[9A08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 12981 0000136F 1E                      		push	ds
 12982 00001370 07                      		pop	es
 12983                                  win_iret:				
 12984 00001371 1F                      		pop	ds
 12985                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022	
 12986 00001372 EB88                    		jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 12987                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12988                                  
 12989                                  handle_multmult:			
 12990 00001374 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 12991 00001376 7515                    		jnz	short try_2
 12992 00001378 1E                      		push	ds
 12993 00001379 E84700                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 12994                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12995                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 12996                                  		;dec	bx
 12997 0000137C BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 12998 0000137F 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 12999 00001381 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13000 00001383 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13001 00001385 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13002 00001387 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13003 00001389 43                      		inc	bx
 13004                                  try_1:					
 13005 0000138A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13006 0000138B EBE5                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13007                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13008                                  
 13009                                  try_2:					
 13010 0000138D 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13011 0000138F 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13012 00001391 1E                      		push	ds
 13013                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13014                                  		;xor	di, di
 13015                                  		;dec	di
 13016 00001392 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13017 00001395 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13018 00001397 E82900                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13019 0000139A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13020 0000139D 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13021 0000139F F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13022 000013A1 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13023 000013A3 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13024                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13025                                  		;sub	di, di
 13026                                  		;dec	di
 13027 000013A5 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13028 000013A8 EB16                    		jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13029                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13030                                  
 13031                                  try_4:					
 13032                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13033 000013AA 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13034 000013AE 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13035                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13036                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13037 000013B1 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13038                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13039 000013B4 011E[F508]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13040 000013B8 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13041 000013BA C706[F508]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13042                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13043                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13044                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13045 000013C0 1F                      		pop	ds
 13046                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13047                                  try_3:		
 13048 000013C1 EBAF                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13049                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13050                                  
 13051                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13052                                  ;try_3:					
 13053                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13054                                  
 13055                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13056                                  
 13057                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13058                                  
 13059                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13060                                  ;
 13061                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13062                                  ;
 13063                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13064                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13065                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13066                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13067                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13068                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13069                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13070                                  ;
 13071                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13072                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13073                                  ;
 13074                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13075                                  
 13076                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13077                                  HMAPtr:
 13078 000013C3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13079                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13080 000013C8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13081                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13082 000013CC 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13083 000013CF 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13084 000013D1 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13085                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13086 000013D6 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13087 000013D8 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13088                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13089 000013DC 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13090                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13091                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13092 000013E0 C3                      		retn
 13093                                  
 13094                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13095                                  
 13096                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13097                                  
 13098                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13099                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13100                                  
 13101                                  move_sector:
 13102                                  
 13103                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13104                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13105                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13106                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13107                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13108                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13109                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13110                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13111                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13112                                  ;
 13113                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13114                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13115                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13116                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13117                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13118                                  
 13119 000013E1 FC                      		cld
 13120 000013E2 51                      		push	cx
 13121 000013E3 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13122 000013E6 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13123 000013EA 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13124 000013EC 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13125 000013F0 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13126 000013F2 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13127 000013F4 59                      		pop	cx
 13128 000013F5 C3                      		retn
 13129                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13130                                  
 13131                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13132 000013F6 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13133 000013F8 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13134 000013FA 59                      		pop	cx
 13135 000013FB C3                      		retn
 13136                                  
 13137                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13138                                  
 13139                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13140                                  
 13141                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13142                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13143                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13144                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13145                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13146                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13147                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13148                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13149                                  ;
 13150                                  ; input conditions:
 13151                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13152                                  ;
 13153                                  ; output:
 13154                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13155                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13156                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13157                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13158                                  
 13159                                  check_wrap:	
 13160 000013FC 50                      		push	ax
 13161 000013FD 53                      		push	bx
 13162 000013FE 06                      		push	es
 13163 000013FF 57                      		push	di
 13164 00001400 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13165 00001403 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13166                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13167 00001405 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13168                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13169 0000140A 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13170 0000140C 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13171 00001410 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13172 00001412 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13173 00001415 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13174 00001417 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13175 00001419 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13176                                  
 13177                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13178                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13179                                  
 13180 0000141B 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13181 0000141D 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13182                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13183 0000141F 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13184 00001420 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13185                                  					; if on	boundary
 13186                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13187                                  not_on_bound:				
 13188 00001422 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13189 00001425 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13190 00001427 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13191 00001429 40                      		inc	ax
 13192 0000142A 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13193 0000142C 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13194 0000142F 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13195                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13196 00001433 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13197 00001435 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13198 00001436 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13199 00001438 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13200 0000143C F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13201                                  
 13202                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13203                                  
 13204 0000143E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13205 00001440 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13206 00001442 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13207                                  
 13208                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13209                                  
 13210 00001444 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13211 00001446 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13212 00001448 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13213                                  no_head_bound:				
 13214 00001449 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13215 0000144B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13216 0000144C FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13217 0000144E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13218 00001450 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13219 00001452 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13220 00001455 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13221 00001457 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13222 00001459 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13223 0000145B 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13224 0000145D 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13225 0000145F D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13226 00001461 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13227 00001463 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13228                                  no_wrap:				
 13229 00001465 F8                      		clc
 13230 00001466 5F                      		pop	di
 13231 00001467 07                      		pop	es
 13232 00001468 5B                      		pop	bx
 13233 00001469 58                      		pop	ax
 13234 0000146A C3                      		retn
 13235                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13236                                  
 13237                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13238 0000146B 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13239 0000146D FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13240 0000146F EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13241                                  
 13242                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13243                                  
 13244                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13245                                  
 13246                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13247                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13248                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13249                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13250                                  ;
 13251                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13252                                  
 13253                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13254                                  find_bds:	
 13255 00001471 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13256                                  fbds_1:					
 13257 00001475 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13258 00001479 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13259 0000147B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13260                                  					; go to next bds
 13261 0000147E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13262 00001481 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13263 00001483 F9                      		stc
 13264                                  fdbs_2:					
 13265 00001484 C3                      		retn
 13266                                  
 13267                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13268                                  
 13269                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13270                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13271                                  doint:
 13272                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13273 00001485 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13274                                  					; get physical drive number
 13275                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13276                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13277                                  		
 13278 00001488 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13279 0000148A 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13280 0000148C 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13281                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13282 0000148E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13283                                  					; get request code
 13284                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13285 00001491 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13286                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13287 00001494 9D                      		popf
 13288                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13289                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13290 00001495 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13291                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13292                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13293 0000149A 9C                      		pushf
 13294                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13295 0000149B 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13296                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13297                                  dointdone:				
 13298 0000149E C3                      		retn
 13299                                  
 13300                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13301                                  
 13302                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13303                                  
 13304                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13305                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13306                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13307                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13308                                  ;
 13309                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13310                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13311                                  ;
 13312                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13313                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13314                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13315                                  
 13316                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13317                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13318                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13319                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13320                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13321                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13322                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13323                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13324                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13325                                  ;end struc
 13326                                  
 13327                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13328                                  
 13329                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13330                                  ;	ah = function
 13331                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13332                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13333                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13334                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13335                                  ;   output conditions:
 13336                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13337                                  
 13338                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13339                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13340                                  ;
 13341                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13342                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13343                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13344                                  
 13345                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13346                                  
 13347                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13348                                  
 13349 0000149F 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13350                                  
 13351                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13352                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13353                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13354                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13355                                  
 13356                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13357                                  
 13358                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13359                                  
 13360                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13361                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13362                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13363                                  
 13364                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13365 000014A3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13366 000014A8 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13367 000014AA 53                      		push	bx
 13368 000014AB BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13369 000014AE E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13370 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13371 000014B2 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13372                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13373                                  
 13374                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13375                                  
 13376                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13377                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13378                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13379                                  
 13380                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13381                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13382 000014B4 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13383 000014B6 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13384 000014B8 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13385 000014B9 51                      		push	cx
 13386 000014BA 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13387 000014BC B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13388 000014BE D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13389 000014C0 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13390 000014C4 59                      		pop	cx
 13391 000014C5 58                      		pop	ax
 13392 000014C6 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13393                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13394 000014C8 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13395 000014C9 06                      		push	es
 13396                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13397 000014CA 2EC41E[9F14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13398                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13399                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13400 000014CF 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13401 000014D1 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13402 000014D4 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13403                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13404                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13405 000014D8 07                      		pop	es
 13406 000014D9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13407 000014DA EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13408                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13409                                  
 13410                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13411                                  
 13412                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13413                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13414                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13415                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13416                                  
 13417                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13418 000014DC 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13419                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13420 000014E1 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13421 000014E3 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13422                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13423 000014E8 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13424                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13425 000014EA 50                      		push	ax
 13426 000014EB B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13427                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13428                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13429 000014ED 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13430                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13431                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13432 000014F2 58                      		pop	ax
 13433 000014F3 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13434                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13435                                  
 13436                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13437                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13438                                  
 13439                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13440                                  
 13441                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13442                                  
 13443                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13444                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13445                                  
 13446                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13447 000014F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13448                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13449                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13450 000014F6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13451                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13452                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13453                                  
 13454                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13455                                  
 13456 000014FB A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13457 000014FE 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13458 00001501 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13459                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13460                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13461 00001503 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13462 00001508 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13463                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13464                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13465                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13466 0000150A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13467                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13468                                  		
 13469 0000150F 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13470                                  		
 13471 00001510 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13472                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13473 00001515 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13474                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13475                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13476 00001517 9D                      		popf
 13477 00001518 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13478                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13479 0000151A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13480 0000151B CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13481                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13482                                  
 13483                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13484                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13485                                  ; a changeline error.
 13486                                  
 13487                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13488 0000151E 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13489                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13490 00001520 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13491 00001523 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13492 00001525 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13493 00001527 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13494 00001529 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13495 0000152E 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13496                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13497                                  					; never	would
 13498 00001530 53                      		push	bx
 13499 00001531 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13500 00001534 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13501 00001537 5B                      		pop	bx
 13502                                  int13b:					
 13503 00001538 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13504 00001539 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13505                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13506                                  
 13507                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13508                                  
 13509                                  goterr13:				
 13510 0000153B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13511 0000153E 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13512                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13513 00001540 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13514 00001543 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13515 00001545 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13516 0000154A 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13517                                  
 13518 0000154C 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13519                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13520                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13521                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13522 00001551 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13523                                  
 13524 00001553 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13525                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13526                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13527 00001555 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13528                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13529                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13530 0000155A A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13531 0000155D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13532 0000155F 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13533 00001561 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13534 00001563 53                      		push	bx
 13535 00001564 51                      		push	cx
 13536 00001565 52                      		push	dx
 13537 00001566 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13538                                  loop_ecc:				
 13539 00001569 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13540                                  
 13541                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13542                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13543                                  ;
 13544                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13545                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13546                                  ; track.
 13547                                  ;
 13548                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13549                                  ; this request.
 13550                                  ;
 13551                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13552                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13553                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13554                                  ;
 13555 0000156C E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13556                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13557                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13558 0000156F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13559                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13560 00001574 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13561 00001576 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13562 00001579 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13563 0000157B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13564 0000157E 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13565                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13566                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13567                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13568 00001580 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13569                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13570                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13571                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13572                                  ok11_op:				
 13573 00001582 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13574 00001586 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13575 00001588 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13576                                  					; add 200h to address
 13577 0000158A FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13578 0000158C FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13579 0000158E EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13580                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13581                                  
 13582                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13583                                  
 13584                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13585 00001590 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13586                                  ok11_exit:				
 13587 00001591 5A                      		pop	dx
 13588 00001592 59                      		pop	cx
 13589 00001593 5B                      		pop	bx
 13590 00001594 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13591                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13592                                  
 13593                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13594                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13595                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13596                                  
 13597                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13598 00001596 06                      		push	es
 13599 00001597 53                      		push	bx
 13600 00001598 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13601 0000159B 1E                      		push	ds
 13602 0000159C 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13603 0000159D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13604                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13605                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13606 000015A0 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13607                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13608 000015A5 5B                      		pop	bx
 13609 000015A6 07                      		pop	es
 13610 000015A7 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13611 000015A9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13612 000015AC 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13613                                  
 13614                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13615                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13616                                  
 13617                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13618 000015AE 56                      		push	si
 13619 000015AF 57                      		push	di
 13620 000015B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13621 000015B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13622 000015B5 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13623 000015B8 5F                      		pop	di
 13624 000015B9 5E                      		pop	si
 13625 000015BA EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13626                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13627                                  
 13628                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13629                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13630                                  
 13631                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13632 000015BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13633 000015BF FB                      		sti
 13634 000015C0 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13635 000015C3 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13636                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13637                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13638 000015C5 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13639 000015C8 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13640 000015CA 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13641 000015CD 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13642 000015CF 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13643                                  
 13644                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13645                                  
 13646                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13647                                  
 13648 000015D1 52                      		push	dx
 13649 000015D2 51                      		push	cx
 13650 000015D3 53                      		push	bx
 13651 000015D4 50                      		push	ax
 13652 000015D5 55                      		push	bp
 13653 000015D6 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13654 000015D8 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13655 000015DA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13656 000015DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13657 000015DE D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13658 000015E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13659 000015E2 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13660 000015E4 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13661                                  
 13662                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13663                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13664                                  
 13665 000015E8 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13666 000015EA E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13667                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13668                                  
 13669                                  no_skip_first:				
 13670 000015ED D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13671 000015EF B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13672 000015F1 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13673                                  
 13674                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13675                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13676                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13677                                  ;
 13678                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13679                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13680                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13681                                  ; in error.
 13682                                  
 13683 000015F3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13684 000015F5 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13685                                  
 13686                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13687                                  
 13688 000015F7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13689                                  					; set up head number
 13690 000015FA E888FE                  		call	doint
 13691 000015FD E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13692                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13693                                  
 13694                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13695 00001600 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13696 00001602 F9                      		stc
 13697 00001603 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13698                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13699                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13700                                  
 13701                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13702                                  
 13703                                  intverify:				
 13704 00001606 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13705 00001607 53                      		push	bx
 13706 00001608 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13707 00001609 07                      		pop	es
 13708                                  dosimple:				
 13709 0000160A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13710                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13711                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13712                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13713 0000160D 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13714                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13715 00001612 5B                      		pop	bx
 13716 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 13717 00001614 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13718                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13719                                  
 13720                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13721                                  
 13722                                  intformat:				
 13723 00001617 06                      		push	es
 13724 00001618 53                      		push	bx
 13725 00001619 56                      		push	si
 13726 0000161A 57                      		push	di
 13727 0000161B 1E                      		push	ds
 13728                                  
 13729                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13730                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13731                                  
 13732 0000161C 06                      		push	es
 13733 0000161D 1E                      		push	ds
 13734 0000161E 07                      		pop	es
 13735 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13736 00001620 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13737 00001622 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13738 00001625 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13739 00001628 1F                      		pop	ds
 13740 00001629 5F                      		pop	di
 13741 0000162A 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13742 0000162B EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13743                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13744                                  
 13745                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13746                                  ; the first block.
 13747                                  ;
 13748                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13749                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13750                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13751                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13752                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13753                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13754                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13755                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13756                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13757                                  
 13758                                  doblock:
 13759                                  
 13760                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13761                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13762                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13763                                  				
 13764 0000162D 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13765                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13766 00001630 51                      		push	cx
 13767 00001631 06                      		push	es
 13768 00001632 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13769                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13770 00001633 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13771 00001636 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13772                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13773 0000163A 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13774                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13775 0000163F 5F                      		pop	di
 13776 00001640 07                      		pop	es
 13777 00001641 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13778 00001643 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13779 00001645 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13780 00001647 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13781                                  doblockflop:				
 13782 00001649 59                      		pop	cx
 13783                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13784 0000164A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13785 0000164C 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13786 0000164E 50                      		push	ax
 13787 0000164F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13788 00001651 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13789                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13790                                  
 13791                                  doblocklast:				
 13792 00001653 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13793 00001655 50                      		push	ax
 13794                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13795 00001656 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13796 00001659 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13797 0000165B 58                      		pop	ax
 13798 0000165C 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13799                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13800 0000165F 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13801 00001661 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13802 00001663 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13803 00001665 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13804 00001667 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13805                                  					; then we are done already.
 13806 00001669 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13807                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13808 0000166B E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13809 0000166E EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13810                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13811                                  
 13812                                  bufferx:				
 13813 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13814                                  					; set up head number
 13815                                  buffer:					
 13816 00001673 53                      		push	bx
 13817 00001674 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13818 00001677 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13819 0000167A 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13820                                  					
 13821                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13822                                  
 13823 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 13824 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds
 13825 0000167E 56                      		push	si
 13826 0000167F 57                      		push	di
 13827 00001680 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13828 00001681 06                      		push	es
 13829 00001682 1F                      		pop	ds
 13830 00001683 07                      		pop	es
 13831 00001684 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13832 00001687 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13833 00001688 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13834 0000168A E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13835 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13836                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13837 0000168E 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13838 0000168F 5E                      		pop	si
 13839 00001690 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13840                                  
 13841                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13842                                  
 13843 00001691 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13844                                  					; get drive number
 13845 00001693 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13846 00001696 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13847                                  					;
 13848                                  					; ah is	function
 13849                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13850                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13851                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13852                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13853                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13854 00001699 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13855 0000169C 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13856 0000169D 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13857 0000169F EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13858                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13859                                  
 13860                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13861                                  
 13862                                  doread:					
 13863 000016A1 06                      		push	es
 13864 000016A2 53                      		push	bx
 13865 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13866 000016A4 07                      		pop	es
 13867 000016A5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13868 000016A8 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13869 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13870                                  					; get drive number
 13871 000016AD E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13872                                  					; ah = function
 13873                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13874                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13875                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13876 000016B0 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13877 000016B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 13878 000016B4 07                      		pop	es
 13879 000016B5 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13880 000016B7 56                      		push	si
 13881 000016B8 57                      		push	di
 13882 000016B9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13883 000016BB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13884 000016BE E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13885 000016C1 5F                      		pop	di
 13886 000016C2 5E                      		pop	si
 13887                                  
 13888                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13889                                  
 13890                                  dotail:					
 13891 000016C3 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13892 000016C4 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13893 000016C7 41                      		inc	cx
 13894 000016C8 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13895 000016CB F8                      		clc
 13896 000016CC FEC8                    		dec	al
 13897 000016CE 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13898                                  
 13899                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 13900                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 13901                                  
 13902 000016D0 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13903 000016D3 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 13904 000016D6 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 13905                                  
 13906                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 13907                                  
 13908                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 13909                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 13910                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 13911                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 13912                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 13913                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 13914                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 13915                                  
 13916                                  bad13:					
 13917 000016D9 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 13918 000016DB 5D                      		pop	bp
 13919 000016DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 13920 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13921 000016DE 59                      		pop	cx
 13922 000016DF 5A                      		pop	dx
 13923 000016E0 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 13924 000016E2 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 13925                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13926                                  
 13927                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 13928 000016E5 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 13929                                  
 13930                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13931                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13932                                  		;db 	0
 13933                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13934                                  
 13935                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 13936

 13945                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 13946 000016E8 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 13947 000016EC BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 13948 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 13949 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 13950 000016F1 E9C4EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 13951                                  
 13952                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13953                                  
 13954                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13955                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 13956                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 13957                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 13958                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13959                                  
 13960                                  install_bds:		
 13961 000016F4 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 13962 000016F5 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 13963                                  
 13964                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 13965                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 13966                                  loop_next_bds:				
 13967 000016F8 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 13968                                  					; fetch	next bds
 13969 000016FA 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13970 000016FE 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 13971                                  					; drive	with new one?
 13972 00001701 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 13973 00001703 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 13974 00001705 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13975                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 13976 00001709 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 13977 0000170C 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 13978                                  					; we don't own it
 13979 00001711 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 13980                                  					; determine if changeline available
 13981 00001714 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 13982 00001717 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13983                                  next_bds:				
 13984 0000171B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 13985                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 13986 0000171E 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 13987 00001720 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 13988                                  					; install bds
 13989 00001723 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 13990 00001725 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 13991                                  					; set next pointer to null
 13992 0000172A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13993                                  
 13994                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 13995                                  ;
 13996                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 13997                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 13998                                  ;
 13999                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14000                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14001                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14002                                  ;
 14003                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14004                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14005                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14006                                  
 14007 0000172B C3                      		retn

 14114                                  ; input : es:di points to current bds for drive.
 14115                                  ; return : zero set if no open files
