 20744 00001025 4B                      	dec	bx			; make sure!!!.
 20745 00001026 B44A                    	mov	ah,4Ah ; SETBLOCK
 20746 00001028 CD21                    	int	21h			; this will free (confbot to top of memory)
 20747                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 20748                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 20749                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 20750 0000102A BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 20751 0000102D B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20752 0000102F CD21                    	int	21h
 20753 00001031 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20754 00001033 CD21                    	int	21h			; allocate (confbot to top of memory)
 20755                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 20756                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 20757 00001035 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax		; save allocated memory segment.
 20758                                  					; need this to free this area for command.com.
 20759 00001038 8E06[E003]              	mov	es,[memhi]
 20760 0000103C B449                    	mov	ah,49h			; free allocated memory.
 20761 0000103E CD21                    	int	21h			; free (memhi to confbot(=area))
 20762                                  		; DOS - 2+ - FREE MEMORY
 20763                                  		; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 20764                                  endfile_ret:
 20765 00001040 C3                      	retn
 20766                                  
 20767                                  ; End of "EndFile" DOS structure configuration.
 20768                                  
 20769                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20770                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20771                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 20772                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20773                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20774                                  ;
 20775                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20776                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20777                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20778                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20779                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20780                                  ; program).
 20781                                  
 20782                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20783                                  
 20784                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20785                                  
 20786 00001041 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20787                                  
 20788                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20789                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20790                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20791                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20792                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20793                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20794                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20795                                  ; carridge return.
 20796                                  
 20797                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20798                                  ;character after =.
 20799                                  
 20800 00001042 06                      	push	es
 20801 00001043 1E                      	push	ds
 20802 00001044 07                      	pop	es
 20803 00001045 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20804 00001046 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20805                                  
 20806 00001048 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20807 0000104A FC                      	cld
 20808 0000104B 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20809 00001051 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20810                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20811 00001054 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20812 00001055 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20813 00001057 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20814 00001059 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20815                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20816 0000105B AC                      	lodsb
 20817 0000105C 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20818 0000105F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20819 00001061 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 20820 00001063 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 20821 00001065 47                      	inc	di
 20822 00001066 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 20823                                  done_installparm:
 20824 00001068 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 20825 0000106D 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 20826 00001070 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 20827 00001072 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 20828                                  					; starts with cr.
 20829                                  install_seg_set:
 20830 00001078 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 20831 0000107F 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 20832                                  
 20833                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 20834                                  ;
 20835                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 20836                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 20837                                  ;
 20838                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 20839                                  ;
 20840                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 20841                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 20842                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 20843                                  ;
 20844                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20845                                  
 20846                                  ;;ifdef   MULTI_CONFIG
 20847                                  
 20848                                  ; If there's any environment data in "config_wrkseg", pass to app
 20849                                  
 20850                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20851                                          ;mov     cx,ax
 20852                                          ;cmp     word [cs:config_envlen],0
 20853                                          ;je      short no_envdata2
 20854                                          ;mov     cx,[cs:config_wrkseg]
 20855                                  ;no_envdata2:
 20856                                  ;;endif  ;MULTI_CONFIG
 20857                                  
 20858                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_environ],cx ; set the environment seg.
 20859                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20860                                  	;mov	[cs:iexec.environ],cx
 20861                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20862 00001081 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 20863                                  
 20864                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 20865 00001085 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 20866                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20867 00001089 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20868                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20869 0000108D 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20870 00001091 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 20871 00001094 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 20872 00001098 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20873 0000109A B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 20874 0000109C BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 20875 0000109F 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 20876 000010A0 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 20877 000010A1 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 20878                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 20879                                  
 20880                                  ;----------------------------------------
 20881                                  
 20882                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 20883                                  
 20884                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20885                                  
 20886                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 20887 000010A6 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 20888 000010A7 06                      	push	es
 20889 000010A8 1E                      	push	ds
 20890 000010A9 07                      	pop	es
 20891 000010AA 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 20892 000010AB 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 20893                                  
 20894 000010AD 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 20895 000010AE E8AF22                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 20896 000010B1 5E                      	pop	si
 20897                                  
 20898                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20899                                  	;jmp	short sysinitptr_retn ; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1140h)
 20900                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20901                                  	; ds = cs
 20902 000010B2 C3                      	retn
 20903                                  
 20904                                  install_exit_ret:
 20905                                  	;retn		; retn (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h) ; 18/12/2022
 20906                                  
 20907                                  	; 24/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20908                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 20909 000010B3 B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 20910 000010B5 CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 20911 000010B7 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3
 20912 000010BA 7404                    	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 20913 000010BC E89316                  	call    error_line
 20914 000010BF F9                      	stc
 20915                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 20916 000010C0 C3                      	retn

 20918                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20919                                  
 20920                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20921                                  ;
 20922                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20923                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20924                                  ;
 20925                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20926                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 20927                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 20928                                  
 20929                                  ParaRound:
 20930 000010C1 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20931 000010C4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 20932 000010C6 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20933 000010C8 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20934 000010CA D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20935 000010CC C3                      	retn
 20936                                  
 20937                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20938                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 20939                                  ;
 20940                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 20941                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 20942                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 20943                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 20944                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 20945                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 20946                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 20947                                  ;
 20948                                  ;in: after relocation,
 20949                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 20950                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 20951                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 20952                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 20953                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 20954                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 20955                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 20956                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 20957                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 20958                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 20959                                  ;
 20960                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 20961                                  
 20962                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20963                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20964                                  sysinit_base:				
 20965 000010CD 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 20966 000010D2 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 20967 000010D7 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 20968 000010D9 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 20969 000010DE 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 20970 000010E3 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 20971 000010E4 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 20972 000010E5 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 20973                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 20974                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 20975 000010E7 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 20976 000010EA 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 20977 000010EF 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 20978                                  
 20979                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 20980                                  
 20981 000010F1 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20982 000010F3 0E                      	push	cs
 20983 000010F4 1F                      	pop	ds
 20984 000010F5 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20985 000010F8 CD21                    	int	21h
 20986                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20987                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20988                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20989                                  _stall: 
 20990                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20991 000010FA F4                      	hlt 
 20992                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20993                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 20994 000010FB EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 20995                                  
 20996                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 20997 000010FD 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 20998                                  
 20999                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21000                                  
 21001                                  sum_up:
 21002                                  
 21003                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21004                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21005                                  ;
 21006                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21007                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21008                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21009                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21010                                  ;
 21011                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21012                                  
 21013 00001102 1E                      	push	ds
 21014                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21015                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21016 00001103 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21017 00001107 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21018 00001109 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21019 0000110B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21020 0000110D 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21021                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21022 00001112 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21023 00001114 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21024                                  sum1:
 21025 00001116 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21026 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21027 00001119 46                      	inc	si
 21028 0000111A E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21029                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21030                                  sum_sys_code:
 21031                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21032 0000111C BE1C11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21033                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21034                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21035                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21036                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21037                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21038                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21039                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21040 0000111F B9[7039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21041 00001122 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21042 00001124 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21043                                  sum2:
 21044 00001126 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21045 00001129 46                      	inc	si
 21046 0000112A 46                      	inc	si
 21047 0000112B E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21048 0000112D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21049 0000112E C3                      	retn
 21050                                  
 21051                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21052                                  
 21053                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21054                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21055 0000112F 0000                    	dw	0
 21056                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21057                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21058 00001131 0000                    	dw	0
 21059                                  
 21060                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 21061                                  
 21062                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 21063                                  
 21064                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h

 21066 0000113E 6C6F636174696F6E20-

 21072                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21073                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21074                                  ;
 21075                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21076                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21077                                  ;
 21078                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21079                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21080                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21081                                  ;
 21082                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21083                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21084                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21085                                  
 21086                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21087                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21088                                  
 21089                                  set_buffer:
 21090 0000114E 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21091 00001150 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21092 00001153 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21093 00001155 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21094                                  set_buff_1:
 21095                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21096                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21097 00001157 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21098                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21099 00001159 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21100                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21101 0000115C C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21102                                  
 21103 00001161 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21104 00001163 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21105 00001168 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21106                                  
 21107                                  ;	for each buffer
 21108                                  
 21109                                  nxt_buff:
 21110 00001169 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 21111 0000116C 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 21112 0000116E E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21113

 21115                                  
 21116 00001175 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 21117                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21118 00001176 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21119 00001179 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21120                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21121                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21122 0000117B 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 21123                                  
 21124 0000117F 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 21125 00001181 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21126                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21127 00001183 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21128 00001187 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21129                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21130 0000118B C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21131                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21132 00001190 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21133 00001193 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21134                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21135 00001197 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21136                                  set_buff_2:
 21137 0000119A 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 21138                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 21139 0000119F 2E800E[3614]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 21142                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21145                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21146                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21147                                  ;
 21148                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21149                                  ;
 21150                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21151                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21152                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21153                                  
 21154                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21155                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21156 000011A8 53                      	push	bx
 21157 000011A9 52                      	push	dx
 21158 000011AA 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21159 000011AE 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21160                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21161 000011B3 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21162                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21163                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21164                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21165 000011B6 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21166 000011B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21167 000011BA B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21168                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21169 000011BD CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21170 000011BF 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21171 000011C2 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21172 000011C4 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21173                                  	;zf=1
 21174                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21175                                  	;zf=1
 21176 000011C7 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21177                                  got_hma:
 21178 000011CC 5A                      	pop	dx
 21179 000011CD 5B                      	pop	bx
 21180 000011CE C3                      	retn
 21181                                  
 21182                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21183                                  
 21184                                  set_buffer_info:
 21185                                  
 21186                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 21187                                  ;
 21188                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 21189                                  ;    ax = di
 21190                                  ;
 21191                                  ;out:
 21192                                  ;    above entries set.
 21193                                  
 21194                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21195 000011CF 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21196                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21197 000011D4 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21198 000011D8 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21199 000011DC 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 21200                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21201 000011E1 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax

 21203 000011E4 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh

 21205 000011EA 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21206                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21207 000011F0 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 21209                                  
 21210                                  ; ======================================================================
 21211                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21212                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21213                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21214                                  
 21215                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21216                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21217                                  ;
 21218                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21219                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21220                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21221                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21222                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21223                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21224                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21225                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21226                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21227                                  ;
 21228                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21229                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21230                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21231                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21232                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21233                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21234                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21235                                  ;	conditions:
 21236                                  ;
 21237                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21238                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21239                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21240                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21241                                  ;
 21242                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21243                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21244                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21245                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21246                                  ;
 21247                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21248                                  ;
 21249                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21250                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21251                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21252                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21253                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21254                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21255                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21256                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21257                                  ;
 21258                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21259                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21260                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21261                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21262                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21263                                  ;
 21264                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21265                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21266                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21267                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21268                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21269                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21270                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21271                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21272                                  ;
 21273                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21274                                  
 21275                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21276                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21277                                  
 21278                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21279                                  stackinit:
 21280 000011F7 50                      	push	ax
 21281 000011F8 1E                      	push	ds
 21282 000011F9 06                      	push	es
 21283 000011FA 53                      	push	bx
 21284 000011FB 51                      	push	cx
 21285 000011FC 52                      	push	dx
 21286 000011FD 57                      	push	di
 21287 000011FE 56                      	push	si
 21288 000011FF 55                      	push	bp
 21289                                  
 21290                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21291                                  
 21292                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21293                                  	; ds = cs
 21294 00001200 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21295 00001203 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21296                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21297                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21298                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21299 00001205 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21300                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21301 00001209 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21302 0000120C 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21303                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21304 00001210 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21305                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21306                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21307                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21308 00001213 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21309                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21310 00001217 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21311 00001219 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21312                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21313                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21314                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21315 0000121C 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21316                                  
 21317                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21318                                  
 21319                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21320                                  
 21321                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21322                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21323                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21324 00001220 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21325

 21327                                  
 21328 00001225 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21329                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21330                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21331                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21332 00001228 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21333 0000122A 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21334 0000122C 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21335 00001230 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21336 00001232 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21337                                  
 21338                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21339                                  
 21340 00001235 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21341 0000123A 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21342 0000123E F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21343 00001240 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21344 00001242 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21345 00001244 06                      	push	es
 21346 00001245 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21347                                  
 21348                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21349                                  
 21350 00001246 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21351 0000124A FC                      	cld
 21352 0000124B F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21353                                  
 21354 0000124D 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21355                                  
 21356                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21357                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21358                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21359                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21360                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 22110                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22111                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22112                                  
 22113                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22114                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22115                                  
 22116                                  new_init_loop:
 22117                                  
 22118                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22119                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22120                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22121                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22122                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22123                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22124                                  
 22125 000013EC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22126 000013EF 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22127 000013F1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22128 000013F5 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22129                                  
 22130 000013F8 1E                      	push	ds
 22131                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22132                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22133                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22134 000013F9 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22135 000013FC 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22136 000013FE 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22137 00001401 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22138 00001403 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22139 00001407 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22140 0000140A 1F                      	pop	ds
 22141                                  
 22142 0000140B 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22143 0000140E 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22144 00001412 C3                      	retn
 22145                                  
 22146                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22147                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22148                                  
 22149                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22150                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22151                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22152                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22153                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22154                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22155                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22156                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22157                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22158                                  
 22159                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22160                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22161                                  
 22162                                  setdevmark:
 22163                                  
 22164 00001413 06                      	push	es
 22165 00001414 51                      	push	cx
 22166                                  
 22167 00001415 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22168 0000141A 2E890E[3414]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22169 0000141F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22170                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22171                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22172 00001421 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22173 00001425 41                      	inc	cx
 22174                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22175 00001426 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22176                                  
 22177 0000142B 59                      	pop	cx
 22178 0000142C 07                      	pop	es
 22179 0000142D 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22180 00001432 C3                      	retn
 22181

 22376 00000001 ????                     .Off:	 resw 1				;AN000; offset address of the table

 22379                                  
 22380                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22381                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22382                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22383                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22384                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22385                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22386                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22387                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22388                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22389                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22390                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22391                                  
 22392                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22393                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22394 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22395 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22396 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22397                                  endstruc
 22398                                  
 22399                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22400                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22401                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22402                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22403                                  
 22404                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22405                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22406                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22407                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22408                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22409                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22410                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22411                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22412                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22413                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22414                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22415                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22416                                  
 22417                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22418                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22419 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22420 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22421 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22422                                  endstruc
 22423                                  
 22424                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22425                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22426                                  ;
 22427                                  ;
 22428                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22429                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22430                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22431                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22432                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22433                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22434                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22435                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22436                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22437                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22438                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22439                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22440                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22441                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22442                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22443                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22444                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22445                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22446                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22447                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22448                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22449                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22450                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22451                                  ;	   :
 22452                                  ;
 22453                                  ;Note:
 22454                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22455                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22456                                  ;
 22457                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22458                                  ;
 22459                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22460                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22461                                  ;
 22462                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22463                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22464                                  ;
 22465                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22466                                  ;
 22467                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22468                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22469                                  ;
 22470                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22471                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22472                                  ;
 22473                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22474                                  ;
 22475                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22476                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22477                                  ;
 22478                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22479                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22480                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22481                                  ;
 22482                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22483                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22484                                  ;
 22485                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22486                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22487                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22488                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22489                                  
 22490                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22491                                  
 22492                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22493                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22494                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22495                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22496                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22497                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22498                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22499                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22500                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22501                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22502                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22503                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22504                                  
 22505                                  ;**** Function flags
 22506                                  
 22507                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22508                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22509                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22510                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22511                                  
 22512                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22513                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22514 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22515 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22516 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22517 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22518 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22519 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22520                                  endstruc
 22521                                  
 22522                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22523                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22524                                  ;
 22525                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22526                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22527                                  ;	     +-
 22528                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22529                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22530                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22531                                  ;	     |	:
 22532                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22533                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22534                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22535                                  ;	     |	:
 22536                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22537                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22538                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22539                                  ;	     +-	:
 22540                                  ;
 22541                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22542                                  ;
 22543                                  ;Note:
 22544                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22545                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22546                                  ;
 22547                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22548                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22549                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22550                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22551                                  
 22552                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22553                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22554                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22555                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22556                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22557                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22558                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22559                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22560                                  
 22561                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22562 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22563 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22564 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22565 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22566 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22567                                  endstruc
 22568                                  
 22569                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22570                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22571                                  ;
 22572                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22573                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22574                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22575                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22576                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22577                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22578                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22579                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22580                                  ;
 22581                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22582                                  ;
 22583                                  ;            +-
 22584                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22585                                  ;	    | or
 22586                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22587                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22588                                  ;	    | or
 22589                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22590                                  ;	    | or
 22591                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22592                                  ;	    | or
 22593                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22594                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22595                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22596                                  ;	    | or
 22597                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22598                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22599                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22600                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22601                                  ;	    +-
 22602                                  ;
 22603                                  ;
 22604                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22605                                  ;      list.
 22606                                  ;
 22607                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22608                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22609                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22610                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22611                                  
 22612                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22613                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22614 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22615 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22616 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22617 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22618                                  endstruc

 22626                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String

 22630                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 22631                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22632                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String

 22637                                  ;

 22641                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 22642                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 22643                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22644                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22645                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22646                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22647                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22648                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22649                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 22659 00001441 0000                    _$P_DX:		   dw	0		;AN000; Return result buffer address
 22660 00001443 00                      _$P_Terminator:	   db	0		;AN000; Terminator code (ASCII)

 22662 00001446 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_SEG:	   dw	0		;AN000; Segment of DBCS EV
 22663 00001448 0000                    _$P_Flags:	   dw	0		;AN000; Parser internal flags
 22664                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags
 22665                                  %define _$P_Flags2 _$P_Flags+1		;AN038; to reference second byte flags only
 22666

 22669                                  _$P_Neg		   equ	02h	      ;AN000; Negative value

 22673                                  _$P_Extra	   equ	20h	      ;AN000; set when extra delimiter found
 22674                                  _$P_SW		   equ	40h	      ;AN000; set when switch found (tm08)
 22675                                  _$P_Signed	   equ	80h	      ;AN000; signed numeric specified
 22676

 22678                                  _$P_time12am	   equ	01h	      ;AN038; set when AM is specified on time

 22680                                  
 22681 0000144A 0000                    _$P_SaveSI_Cmpx:   dw	0		;AN000; save si for later use by complex

 22733                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22734                                  ; SysParse;
 22735                                  ;
 22736                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22737                                  ;
 22738                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22739                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22740                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22741                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22742                                  ;
 22743                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22744                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22745                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22746                                  ;
 22747                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22748                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22749                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22750                                  ;
 22751                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22752                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22753                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22754                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22755                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22756                                  ;
 22757                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22758                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22759                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22760                                  ;
 22761                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22762                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22763                                  ;
 22764                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22765                                  ;
 22766                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22767                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22768                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22769                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22770                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22771                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22772                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22773                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22774                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22775                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22776                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22777                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22778                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22779                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22780                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22781                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22782                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22783                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22784                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22785                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22786                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22787                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22788                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22789                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22790                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22791                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22792                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22793                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22794                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22795                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22796                                  
 22797                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22798                                  
 22799                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22800                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22801                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22802                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22803                                  
 22804                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22805                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22806                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22807                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22808                                  ;
 22809                                  
 22810                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22811                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22812                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22813                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22814                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22815                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22816                                  
 22817                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22818                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22819                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22820                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22821                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22822                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22823                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22824                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22825                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22826                                  
 22827                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22828                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22829                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22830                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22831                                  ;	     segment.
 22832                                  
 22833                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22834                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22835                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22836                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22837                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22838                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22839

 22841                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro

 22854                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 22855                                  
 22856                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 22857                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as

 22860

 22943                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
