 23358                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23359                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23360                                  ;
 23361                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23362                                  ;
 23363                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23364                                  ;	    AL = type
 23365                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23366                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23367                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23368                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23369                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23370                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23371                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23372                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23373                                  ;
 23374                                  ; Output:   None
 23375                                  ;
 23376                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23377                                  ;
 23378                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23379                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23380                                  
 23381                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 23387 0000172C 26886501                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 23388 00001730 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 23391                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 23392 00001739 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23393                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 23394 0000173A 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 23395 0000173C 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;

 23748                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23749                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23750                                  ;
 23751                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23752                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23753                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23754                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23755                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23756                                  ;
 23757                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23758                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23759                                  ;
 23760                                  ; Output:    None
 23761                                  ;
 23762                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 23763                                  ;
 23764                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 23765                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23766                                  
 23767                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23768                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23769                                  
 23770                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 23771 000018DB 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23772 000018DC 2E800E[4914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 23773 000018E2 2E8026[4914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 23774 000018E8 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 23775 000018EB 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 23776 000018ED 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 23777                                  
 23778 000018EF 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 23779 000018F1 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 23780                                  
 23781 000018F3 2E800E[4914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 23782                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 23783 000018F9 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 23784                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 23785 000018FA E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 23786 000018FD 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23787 000018FE C3                      	retn
 23788                                  
 23789                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23790                                  
 23791                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23792                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 23793 000018FF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23794 00001900 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 23795 00001901 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23796 00001902 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23797 00001903 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 23798 00001905 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 23799 00001907 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 23800                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 23801 00001908 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23802 0000190B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 23803 0000190D 7442                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 23804                                  
 23805 0000190F E8F000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 23806 00001912 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 23807                                  
 23808 00001914 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;

 23983                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 23984                                  ;
 23985                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 23986                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 23987                                  ;
 23988                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 23989                                  ;
 23990                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 23991                                  ;
 23992                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 23993                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23994                                  
 23995                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23996                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 23997 000019F0 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 23998 000019F1 2EF606[4914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 23999 000019F7 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24000                                  
 24001 000019F9 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24002 000019FA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24003                                  
 24004                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24005 000019FB 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24006 000019FC 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24007                                  
 24008 000019FE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24009 000019FF C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24010                                  
 24011                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24012 00001A00 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24013 00001A01 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24565 00001C09 7429                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24566                                  
 24567                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 24568 00001C0B 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 24569 00001C0D 7425                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24570                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 24571                                  
 24572 00001C0F 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 24573                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 24574 00001C14 721E                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24575                                  
 24576 00001C16 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 24577 00001C18 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 24578                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24579 00001C1C 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 24580 00001C1F 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 24581 00001C23 740D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 24582                                  
 24583                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 24584 00001C25 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24585 00001C27 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000;
 24586                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 24587 00001C2A 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24588 00001C2B 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 24589 00001C2E 7404                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24590                                  
 24591 00001C30 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 24592                                  
 24593                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 24594 00001C32 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 24595                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 24596 00001C34 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24597 00001C35 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24598 00001C36 C3                      	retn
 24599                                  
 24600                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24601                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 24602                                  ;
 24603                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 24604                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 24605                                  ;	    blanks.
 24606                                  ;
 24607                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24608                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 24609                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24610                                  ;
 24611                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 24612                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 24613                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 24614                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24615                                  
 24616                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 24617 00001C37 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24618 00001C38 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24619 00001C39 2EC606[4314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 24620                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 24621                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 24622 00001C3F 2E8026[4914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 24623 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 24624 00001C47 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24625                                  
 24626 00001C49 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 24627 00001C4B 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24628                                  
 24629 00001C4D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 24630 00001C4F 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24631                                  
 24632                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 24633                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 24634 00001C51 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 24635 00001C53 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24636                                  
 24637 00001C55 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 24638 00001C58 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24639                                  
 24640 00001C5A B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 24641 00001C5C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 24642 00001C5D 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 24643 00001C5F EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24644                                  
 24645                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 24646 00001C61 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 24647                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 24648 00001C66 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24649                                  
 24650                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 24651 00001C68 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24652                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 24653 00001C6A 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 24654                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24655 00001C6E 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 24656 00001C70 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 24657                                  
 24658 00001C72 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 24659                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24660 00001C75 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24661 00001C76 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 24662 00001C79 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24663                                  
 24664 00001C7B E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 24665                                  
 24666                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 24667 00001C7D 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 24668                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 24669                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 24670 00001C7F 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24671 00001C80 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24672 00001C81 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24673                                  
 24674                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 24675 00001C82 2EA2[4314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 24676 00001C86 2EF606[4914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 24677 00001C8C 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 24678                                  
 24679 00001C8E 2E800E[4914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 24680                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 24681                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 24682 00001C94 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 24683 00001C96 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24684                                  
 24685                                  
 24686                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24687                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24688                                  ;
 24689                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24690                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24691                                  ;
 24692                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24693                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24694                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24695                                  ;
 24696                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24697                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24698                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24699                                  
 24700                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24701                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24702                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24703                                  ;
 24704                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24705                                  
 24706                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24707                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24708                                  
 24709                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24710                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24711 00001C98 8D2E[5214]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24712                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24713 00001C9C 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24714 00001C9E 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24715                                  
 24716                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24717 00001CA0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24718 00001CA2 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24719                                  
 24720 00001CA4 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24721                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24722                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24723 00001CA5 C3                      	retn
 24724                                  
 24725                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24726                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24727                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24728                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24729                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24730                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24731                                  
 24732                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24733                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24734 00001CA6 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24735 00001CA8 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24736                                  
 24737 00001CAA 2E800E[4914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24738                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24739                                  
 24740                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24741                                  	; cf=0
 24742                                  	;retn
 24743                                  
 24744                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24745                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24746                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24747 00001CB0 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24748                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24749                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24750 00001CB1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24751                                  
 24752                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24753                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24754                                  ;
 24755                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24756                                  ;
 24757                                  ;  Input:
 24758                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24759                                  ;
 24760                                  ;  Output:
 24761                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24762                                  ;
 24763                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24764                                  ;
 24765                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24766                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24767                                  
 24768                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24769 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24770 00001CB3 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24771 00001CB4 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24772                                  	
 24773 00001CB5 2E833E[4614]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24774 00001CBB 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24775                                  
 24776 00001CBD 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24777 00001CBE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24778 00001CBF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24779 00001CC0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24780 00001CC1 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24781 00001CC2 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24782 00001CC3 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24783 00001CC4 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24784 00001CC6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24785 00001CC8 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24786 00001CCB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24787                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24788 00001CCD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24789 00001CCF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24790 00001CD1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24791 00001CD2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24792 00001CD3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24793 00001CD4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24794 00001CD5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24795 00001CD6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24796 00001CD7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24797 00001CD8 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24798                                  
 24799                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24800 00001CDA 2E8936[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24801 00001CDF 2E891E[4614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24802                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24803 00001CE4 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24804 00001CE9 2E8E1E[4614]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24805                                  
 24806                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24807 00001CEE 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24808 00001CF1 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24809                                  
 24810 00001CF3 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24811 00001CF5 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24812                                  
 24813 00001CF7 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24814 00001CFA 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24815                                  
 24816 00001CFC F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24817 00001CFD EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24818                                  
 24819                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24820 00001CFF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24821 00001D00 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24822                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24823 00001D01 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24824                                  
 24825                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24826                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24827                                  	; cf=0
 24828                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24829                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24830 00001D03 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24831 00001D04 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24832 00001D05 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24833 00001D06 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25384                                  
 25385                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25386                                  
 25387                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25388                                  
 25389                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25390                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25391                                  
 25392                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25393                                  ;
 25394                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25395                                  ;
 25396                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25397                                  ;
 25398                                  ;   Modification log:
 25399                                  ;
 25400                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25401                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25402                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25403                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25404                                  ;
 25405                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25406                                  ;
 25407                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25408                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25409                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25410                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25411                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25412                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25413                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25414                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25415                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25416                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25417                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25418                                  ;
 25419                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25420                                  
 25421                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25422                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25423                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25424                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25425                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25426                                  
 25427                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25428                                  
 25429                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25430                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25431                                  
 25432                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25433                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25434                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25435                                  
 25436                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25437                                  ;
 25438                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25439                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25440                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25441                                  ;	           line.
 25442                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25443                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25444                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25445                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25446                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25447                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25448                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25449                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25450                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25451                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25452                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25453                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25454                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25455                                  ;	           for details).
 25456                                  
 25457                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25458                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25459                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25460                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25461                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25462                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25463                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25464                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25465                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25466                                  
 25467                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25468                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25469                                  
 25470                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25471                                  
 25472                                  %endif
 25473

 25484 00001EEA 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25485 00001EEC 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25486 00001EEE 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25487 00001EF0 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25488 00001EF4 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25489                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25490                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25491                                  ;
 25492 00001EF8 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25493 00001EF9 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25494 00001EFB 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25495 00001EFD 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25496                                  ;
 25497 00001EFF 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25498                                  ;
 25499 00001F03 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 25500 00001F05 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 25501                                  ;
 25502 00001F07 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 25503                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 25504 00001F08 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 25505                                  ;
 25506 00001F0A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 25507 00001F0B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 25508 00001F0D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 25509                                  ;
 25510 00001F15 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 25511 00001F16 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data

 25513 00001F1C 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 25514                                  				; to use the file name in the command line

 25529                                  ; procedure : doconf

 25563                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)

 25579                                  
 25580                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25581                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 25583                                  
 25584 00001F52 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25585 00001F55 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25586 00001F58 E866F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25587 00001F5B 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25588                                  
 25589                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25590                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25591                                  ;;
 25592                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25593                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25594                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25595                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25596                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25597                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25598                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25599                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25600                                  ;;
 25601                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25602                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25603                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25604                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25605                                  
 25606 00001F5D 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25607                                  	
 25608                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25609                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25610                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25611 00001F60 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25612 00001F64 E870EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25613                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25614                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25615 00001F67 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25616                                   
 25617 00001F6C 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25618 00001F6E 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25619                                  
 25620 00001F70 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25621 00001F72 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25622 00001F77 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25623                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25624 00001F79 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25625 00001F7A CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25626 00001F7C 9C                      	pushf
 25627                                  
 25628                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25629                                  
 25630 00001F7D 50                      	push	ax
 25631 00001F7E 57                      	push	di
 25632 00001F7F 51                      	push	cx
 25633 00001F80 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25634 00001F82 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25635 00001F84 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25636 00001F86 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25637 00001F88 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25638                                  
 25639                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25640                                  
 25641 00001F8A 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25642                                  
 25643                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25644                                  
 25645                                  puteol:
 25646 00001F8B B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25647 00001F8D AA                      	stosb
 25648 00001F8E B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25649 00001F90 AA                      	stosb
 25650 00001F91 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25651                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25652                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25653                                  
 25654                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25655                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25656 00001F93 0E                      	push	cs
 25657 00001F94 1F                      	pop	ds
 25658                                  
 25659 00001F95 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25660                                  
 25661 00001F99 59                      	pop	cx
 25662 00001F9A 5F                      	pop	di
 25663 00001F9B 58                      	pop	ax
 25664                                  
 25665                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25666                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25667                                  	;push	cs
 25668                                  	;pop	ds
 25669                                  
 25670 00001F9C 50                      	push	ax
 25671                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25672 00001F9D B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25673 00001F9F CD21                    	int	21h
 25674 00001FA1 58                      	pop	ax
 25675 00001FA2 9D                      	popf
 25676 00001FA3 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25677 00001FA5 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25678 00001FA7 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25679                                  conferr:
 25680 00001FA9 BA[7D34]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25681 00001FAC E8AD13                  	call	badfil
 25682                                  endconv:
 25683 00001FAF C3                      	retn
 25684                                  
 25685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25686                                  ;
 25687                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25688                                  ;
 25689                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25690                                  ;
 25691                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25692                                  
 25693                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25694                                  multi_pass:
 25695 00001FB0 0E                      	push	cs
 25696 00001FB1 1F                      	pop	ds
 25697                                  
 25698 00001FB2 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25699                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25700 00001FB7 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25701                                  
 25702                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25703                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25704 00001FB9 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25705 00001FBD 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25706                                  
 25707 00001FBE 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25708 00001FC2 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25709 00001FC6 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 25710 00001FC8 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 25711 00001FCC 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 25712                                  
 25713 00001FD0 E86807                  	call	getchr
 25714 00001FD3 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 25715                                  
 25716                                  getcom:
 25717 00001FD5 E8B20E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 25718 00001FD8 E86007                  	call	getchr
 25719                                  conflp: 
 25720 00001FDB 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 25721                                  
 25722 00001FDD FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 25723                                  
 25724 00001FE1 C606[3314]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 25725 00001FE6 C606[3614]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 25726 00001FEB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 25727 00001FED 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 25728                                  
 25729                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25730                                  %if 0
 25731                                  
 25732                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25733                                  
 25734                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 25735                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25736                                  
 25737                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 25738                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 25739                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25740                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25741                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25742                                  
 25743                                          push    ax                      ;
 25744                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25745                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25746                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25747                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25748                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25749                                          pop     ax
 25750                                  ;
 25751                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25752                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25753                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25754                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25755                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25756                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25757                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25758                                  ;   spot.
 25759                                  ;
 25760                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25761                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25762                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25763                                  ;   retrieved.
 25764                                  ;
 25765                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25766                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25767                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25768                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25769                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25770                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25771                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25772                                  final:                                  ;
 25773                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25774                                  not_final:                              ;
 25775                                  ;endif
 25776                                  
 25777                                  %endif
 25778 00001FEF 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 25779 00001FF1 E84707                  	call	getchr
 25780 00001FF4 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 25781                                  
 25782 00001FF6 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 25783                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 25784                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25785 00001FFB 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 25786 00001FFD E90707                  	jmp	badop
 25787                                  	
 25788                                  coff:	
 25789                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25790                                  	; ds = cs
 25791                                  	;push	cs
 25792                                  	;pop	ds
 25793 00002000 E89E10                  	call	newline
 25794 00002003 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 25795                                  
 25796                                  blank_line:
 25797 00002005 E83307                  	call	getchr
 25798 00002008 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 25799                                  
 25800                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25801                                  ; 11/12/2022
 25802                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 25803                                  ;coff_p:
 25804                                  	;push	cs
 25805                                  	;pop	ds
 25806                                  
 25807                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 25808                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 25809                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 25810                                  ;install= command.
 25811                                  
 25812                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25813                                  ;install command
 25814                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25815                                  
 25816                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25817                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 25818                                  tryi:
 25819 0000200A 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 25820 0000200F 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 25821 00002011 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 25822                                  not_init_pass:
 25823 00002014 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 25824                                          ; 11/12/2022
 25825                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 25826 00002019 74E5                    	je	short coff
 25827                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25828                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25829                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 25830                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 25831                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 25832                                  					; and before install= commands
 25833                                  					; are processed
 25834                                  
 25835 0000201B 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 25836 00002020 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 25837 00002022 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 25838                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25839                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 25840 00002025 74D9                    	je	short coff
 25841                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25842                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25843                                  
 25844                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 25845                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 25846                                          
 25847 00002027 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 25848                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 25849                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25850 0000202A 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 25851                                  	
 25852                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 25853 0000202C 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25854                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 25855 00002031 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 25856                                  
 25857                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25858                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 25859                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 25860                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 25861                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25862                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25863                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 25864                                  
 25865                                  multi_try_i:
 25866 00002033 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 25867                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 25868                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25869 00002036 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 25870                                  
 25871                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25872                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25873                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25874                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25875                                  ;;endif
 25876                                  
 25877 00002038 E806F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25878 0000203B EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 25879                                  
 25880                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25881                                  %if 0
 25882                                  
 25883                                  multi_try_n:
 25884                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 25885                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 25886                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25887                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25888                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25889                                  ;endif
 25890                                  
 25891                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 25892                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 25893                                  
 25894                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 25895                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 25896                                  	mov	bx,ax
 25897                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 25898                                  
 25899                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 25900                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 25901                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 25902                                  
 25903                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 25904                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 25905                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 25906                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 25907                                  
 25908                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 25909                                  	mov	bx,1
 25910                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 25911                                  
 25912                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25913                                  
 25914                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 25915                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 25916                                          int     21h
 25917                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 25918                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 25919                                          int     21h
 25920                                  
 25921                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 25922                                  
 25923                                  %endif
 25924                                  
 25925                                  multi_pass_filter:
 25926 0000203D 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 25927 00002040 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25928 00002042 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 25929 00002045 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25930 00002047 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 25931 0000204A 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 25932                                  
 25933                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 25934 0000204C FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 25935 00002050 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 25936                                  
 25937                                  multi_pass_coff:
 25938                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25939 00002054 EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 25940                                  
 25941                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25942                                  ; buffer command
 25943                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25944                                  
 25945                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25946                                  ;									      *
 25947                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 25948                                  ;									      *
 25949                                  ; input :								      *
 25950                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 25951                                  ; output:								      *
 25952                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 25953                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 25954                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 25955                                  ;									      *

 25957                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *

 25959                                  ; {									      *

 25971                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *

 27308                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27309                                  ; function: parse the parameters of files= command.			      *
 27310                                  ;									      *
 27311                                  ; input :								      *

 27315                                  ;									      *

 27317                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *

 27492                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27493                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27494                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27495                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27496                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27497                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27498                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27499                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27500                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27501                                  
 27502                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27503                                  ;									  *
 27504                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27505                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27506                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27507                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27508                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27509                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27510                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27511                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27512                                  ; input :								  *
 27513                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27514                                  ; output:								  *
 27515                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27516                                  ;									  *
 27517                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27518                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27519                                  ; logic:								  *
 27520                                  ; {									  *
 27521                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27522                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27523                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27524                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27525                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27526                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27527                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27528                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27529                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27530                                  ;	     }								  *
 27531                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27532                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27533                                  ;	};								  *
 27534                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27535                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27536                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27537                                  ; };									  *
 27538                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27539

 27844                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27845                                  ; fcbs command
 27846                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27847                                  
 27848                                  ;************************************************************************
 27849                                  ; function: parse the parameters of fcbs= command.			*
 27850                                  ;									*
 27851                                  ; input :								*
 27852                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				*
 27853                                  ; output:								*
 27854                                  ;	set the variables fcbs,keep.					*
 27855                                  ;									*
 27856                                  ; subroutines to be called:						*
 27857                                  ;	sysinit_parse							*
 27858                                  ; logic:								*
 27859                                  ; {									*
 27860                                  ;	set di points to fcbs_parms;					*
 27861                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						*
 27862                                  ;	while (end of command line)					*
 27863                                  ;	{ sysparse;							*
 27864                                  ;	  if (no error) then						*
 27865                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = fcbs */		*
 27866                                  ;		   fcbs = result_val._$P_picked_val;			*
 27867                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = keep */ 	*
 27868                                  ;		   keep = result_val._$P_picked_val;			*
 27869                                  ;	     }								*
 27870                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						*
 27871                                  ;	     error exit;						*
 27872                                  ;	};								*
 27873                                  ; };									*
 27874                                  ;************************************************************************
 27875                                  
 27876                                  tryx:

 28207                                  sysinit_parse:
 28208                                  
 28209                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28210                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28211                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28212                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28213                                  ;
 28214                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28215                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28216                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28217                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28218                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28219                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28220                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28221                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28222                                  ;	 procedure.
 28223                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28224                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28225                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28226                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28227                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer

 28397                                  ; 11/12/2022
