 28552                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28553                                  ;
 28554                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28555                                  ;
 28556                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28557                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28558                                  ;
 28559                                  ;	Output : none
 28560                                  ;
 28561                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28562                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28563                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28564                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28565                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28566                                  ;
 28567                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28568                                  
 28569                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28570                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28571                                  	; ds = cs
 28572 000027A4 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 28573                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28574                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28575 000027A7 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28576 000027AA 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28577                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28578                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28579                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28580                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28581                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28582                                  	; ds = cs
 28583 000027AC 803E[071F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28584 000027B1 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28585 000027B3 A1[EE1E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28586                                  lim_set:
 28587                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28588                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28589                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28590                                  ;limx:
 28591                                  	;retn
 28592                                  	
 28593                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28594                                  
 28595                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28596                                  ;
 28597                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28598                                  ;
 28599                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28600                                  ;	Output : none
 28601                                  ;
 28602                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28603                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28604                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28605                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28606                                  ;
 28607                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28608                                  
 28609                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28610                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28611 000027B6 1E                      	push	ds
 28612 000027B7 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28613 000027BA 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28614 000027BC 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28615 000027C0 2E891E[0B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28616 000027C5 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28617 000027C7 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28618 000027C9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28619 000027CC 2EC606[0A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28620 000027D2 1F                      	pop	ds
 28621                                  ;limx:
 28622 000027D3 C3                      	retn
 28623                                  
 28624                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28625                                  ;
 28626                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28627                                  ;
 28628                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28629                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28630                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28631                                  ;
 28632                                  ;	Output : none
 28633                                  ;
 28634                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28635                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28636                                  ;
 28637                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28638                                  
 28639                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28640                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28641                                  	; ds = cs
 28642 000027D4 803E[0A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28643                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28644                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28645                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28646 000027D9 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28647                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28648 000027DB B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28649 000027DE 8826[0A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28650                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28651                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28652 000027E2 1E                      	push	ds
 28653                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28654 000027E3 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28655 000027E5 2EA1[0B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28656 000027E9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28657 000027EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 28658                                  timx:
 28659 000027ED C3                      	retn
 28660                                  
 28661                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 28681 000027F8 0E                      	push	cs

 28707                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28708                                  
 28709                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28710                                  
 28711                                  %if 0
 28712                                  
 28713                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28714                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28715                                  
 28716                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28717                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28718                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28719                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28720                                  
 28721                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28722                                  ;
 28723                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28724                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28725                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28726                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28727                                  ;
 28728                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28729                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28730                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28731                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28732                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28733                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28734                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28735                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28736                                  ; available during the load.
 28737                                  ;
 28738                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28739                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28740                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28741                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28742                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28743                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28744                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28745                                  ;
 28746                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28747                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28748                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28749                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28750                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28751                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28752                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28753                                  ;
 28754                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28755                                  
 28756                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28757                                  
 28758                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28759                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28760                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28761                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28762                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28763                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28764                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28765                                  
 28766                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28767                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28768                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28769                                  
 28770                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28771                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 28772                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28773                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 28774                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 28775                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 28776                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28777                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28778                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 28779                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 28780                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28781                                  
 28782                                  InitVar:
 28783                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 28784                                  	push	ax
 28785                                  	push	cx
 28786                                  	push	di
 28787                                  	push	es
 28788                                  
 28789                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 28790                                  	push	cs
 28791                                  	pop	es
 28792                                  
 28793                                  	xor	ax,ax
 28794                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 28795                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 28796                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 28797                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 28798                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 28799                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 28800                                  
 28801                                  	cld
 28802                                  
 28803                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 28804                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 28805                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 28806                                  
 28807                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 28808                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 28809                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 28810                                  
 28811                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 28812                                  
 28813                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 28814                                  	pop	es
 28815                                  	pop	di
 28816                                  	pop	cx
 28817                                  	pop	ax	 	
 28818                                  
 28819                                  	retn
 28820                                  
 28821                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28822                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 28823                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28824                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 28825                                  ; EXIT    : None
 28826                                  ; ERROR   : None
 28827                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 28828                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28829                                  
 28830                                  FixMem:
 28831                                  	push	ax
 28832                                  	push	bx
 28833                                  	push	cx
 28834                                  	push	dx
 28835                                  	push	es
 28836                                  
 28837                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 28838                                  
 28839                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 28840                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 28841                                  
 28842                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 28843                                  
 28844                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 28845                                  
 28846                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 28847                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 28848                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 28849                                  
 28850                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28851                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 28852                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 28853                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28854                                  
 28855                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 28856                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 28857                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 28858                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 28859                                  
 28860                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 28861                                  
 28862                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 28863                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 28864                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 28865                                  
 28866                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 28867                                  	add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 28868                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 28869                                  
 28870                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 28871                                  
 28872                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 28873                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 28874                                  
 28875                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 28876                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 28877                                  	inc	bx
 28878                                  	mov	es,bx
 28879                                  
 28880                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 28881                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 28882                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 28883                                  fmX:	
 28884                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 28885                                  
 28886                                  	pop	es
 28887                                  	pop	dx
 28888                                  	pop	cx
 28889                                  	pop	bx
 28890                                  	pop	ax
 28891                                  
 28892                                  	retn
 28893                                  
 28894                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28895                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 28896                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28897                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 28898                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 28899                                  ; ERROR:    None
 28900                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 28901                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28902                                  
 28903                                  fm_link:
 28904                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 28905                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 28906                                  
 28907                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 28908                                  	;
 28909                                  	;push	es
 28910                                  	;push	cs
 28911                                  	;pop	es
 28912                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 28913                                  	;pop	es
 28914                                  	
 28915                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 28916                                  
 28917                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 28918                                  	mov	bx,1
 28919                                  	int	21h
 28920                                  	retn
 28921                                  
 28922                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28923                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 28924                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28925                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 28926                                  ; EXIT:     None
 28927                                  ; ERROR:    None
 28928                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 28929                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28930                                  
 28931                                  fm_unlink:
 28932                                  	xor	bx,bx
 28933                                  	
 28934                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 28935                                  	;
 28936                                  	;push	ds
 28937                                  	;push	cs
 28938                                  	;pop	ds
 28939                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 28940                                  	;pop	ds
 28941                                  	
 28942                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 28943                                  
 28944                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 28945                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 28946                                  	retn
 28947                                  
 28948                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28949                                  
 28950                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28951                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 28952                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 28953                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28954                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 28955                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 28956                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 28957                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28958                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28959                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 28960                                  ;
 28961                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 28962                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 28963                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 28964                                  ;
 28965                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 28966                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 28967                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 28968                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 28969                                  ;
 28970                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 28971                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 28972                                  ;
 28973                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28974                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 28975                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 28976                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 28977                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 28978                                  ;     lh
 28979                                  ;     /l
 28980                                  ;     1
 28981                                  ;     1000
 28982                                  ;     2
 28983                                  ;     print
 28984                                  ;     /d
 28985                                  ;     :lpt2
 28986                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 28987                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 28988                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 28989                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 28990                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 28991                                  ; for:
 28992                                  ;    Each /L
 28993                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 28994                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 28995                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 28996                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 28997                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 28998                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28999                                  
 29000                                  ParseVar:
 29001                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29002                                  	push	di
 29003                                  	push	ds
 29004                                  	push	es
 29005                                  
 29006                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29007                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29008                                  	cld
 29009                                  
 29010                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29011                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29012                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29013                                  
 29014                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29015                                  	call	isWhite
 29016                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29017                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29018                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29019                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29020                                  
 29021                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29022                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29023                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29024                                  
 29025                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29026                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29027                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29028                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29029                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29030                                  	jne	short pv30
 29031                                  
 29032                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29033                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29034                                  
 29035                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29036                                  	;
 29037                                  	;push	es
 29038                                  	;push	cs
 29039                                  	;pop	es
 29040                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29041                                  	;pop	es
 29042                                  
 29043                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29044                                  
 29045                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29046                                  
 29047                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29048                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29049                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29050                                  
 29051                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29052                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29053                                  
 29054                                  	call	parseL
 29055                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29056                                  
 29057                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29058                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29059                                  
 29060                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29061                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29062                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29063                                  	dec	si
 29064                                  	stc
 29065                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29066                                  	pop	es
 29067                                  	pop	ds
 29068                                  	pop	di
 29069                                  	retn
 29070                                  
 29071                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29072                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29073                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29074                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29075                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29076                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29077                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29078                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29079                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29080                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29081                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29082                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29083                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29084                                  
 29085                                  parseL:
 29086                                  	lodsb
 29087                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29088                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29089                                  
 29090                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29091                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29092                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29093                                  
 29094                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29095                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29096                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29097                                  
 29098                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29099                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29100                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29101                                  
 29102                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29103                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29104                                  
 29105                                  	lodsb
 29106                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29107                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29108                                  
 29109                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29110                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29111                                  
 29112                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29113                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29114                                  
 29115                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29116                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29117                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29118                                  
 29119                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29120                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29121                                  
 29122                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29123                                  
 29124                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29125                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29126                                  
 29127                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29128                                  
 29129                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29130                                  
 29131                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29132                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29133                                  
 29134                                  	lodsb
 29135                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29136                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29137                                  
 29138                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29139                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29140                                  
 29141                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29142                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29143                                  
 29144                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29145                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29146                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29147                                  plE1:	
 29148                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29149                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29150                                  	dec	si
 29151                                  	stc
 29152                                  	retn
 29153                                  
 29154                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29155                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29156                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29157                                  	; cf=1
 29158                                  	;stc
 29159                                  	retn
 29160                                  plSwX:	
 29161                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29162                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29163                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29164                                  	; cf=0
 29165                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29166                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29167                                  
 29168                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29169                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29170                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29171                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29172                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29173                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29174                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29175                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29176                                  
 29177                                  ;incArgc:
 29178                                  	;push	ax
 29179                                  
 29180                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29181                                  
 29182                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29183                                  
 29184                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29185                                  
 29186                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29187                                  
 29188                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29189                                  
 29190                                  	;pop	ax
 29191                                  	;retn
 29192                                  
 29193                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29194                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29195                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29196                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29197                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29198                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29199                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29200                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29201                                  
 29202                                  isEOL:
 29203                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29204                                  	je	short ieX
 29205                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29206                                  	je	short ieX
 29207                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29208                                  ieX:	
 29209                                  	retn
 29210                                  
 29211                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29212                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29213                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29214                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29215                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29216                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29217                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29218                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29219                                  
 29220                                  isWhite:
 29221                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29222                                  	je	short iwX
 29223                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29224                                  	je	short iwX
 29225                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29226                                  iwX:	
 29227                                  	retn
 29228                                  
 29229                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29230                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29231                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29232                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29233                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29234                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29235                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29236                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29237                                  
 29238                                  unMarkUMB:
 29239                                  	push	ax
 29240                                  	push	bx
 29241                                  	push	di
 29242                                  	push	es
 29243                                  
 29244                                  	push	cs
 29245                                  	pop	es
 29246                                  
 29247                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29248                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29249                                  
 29250                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29251                                  	
 29252                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29253                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29254                                  
 29255                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29256                                  	jne	short umu10
 29257                                  
 29258                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29259                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29260                                  umu10:	
 29261                                  	pop	es
 29262                                  	pop	di
 29263                                  	pop	bx
 29264                                  	pop	ax
 29265                                  	retn
 29266                                  
 29267                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29268                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29269                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29270                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29271                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29272                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29273                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29274                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29275                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29276                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29277                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29278                                  
 29279                                  stowUMB:
 29280                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29281                                  	jb	short su10
 29282                                  	stc
 29283                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29284                                  su10:	
 29285                                  	push	bx
 29286                                  	push	di
 29287                                  	push	si
 29288                                  	push	ds
 29289                                  	push	es
 29290                                  	push	cs
 29291                                  	pop	es
 29292                                  	push	cs
 29293                                  	pop	ds
 29294                                  	
 29295                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29296                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29297                                  	jne	short su20
 29298                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29299                                  su20:	
 29300                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29301                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29302                                  
 29303                                  	mov	bl,al
 29304                                  	xor	bh,bh
 29305                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29306                                  
 29307                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29308                                  
 29309                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29310                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29311                                  
 29312                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29313                                  su30:	
 29314                                  	pop	es
 29315                                  	pop	ds
 29316                                  	pop	si
 29317                                  	pop	di
 29318                                  	pop	bx
 29319                                  	retn
 29320                                  
 29321                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29322                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29323                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29324                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29325                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29326                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29327                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29328                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29329                                  
 29330                                  ; 13/05/2019
 29331                                  
 29332                                  stowSiz:
 29333                                  	push	bx
 29334                                  	;push	di ; ?
 29335                                  	push	es
 29336                                  
 29337                                  	push	cs
 29338                                  	pop	es	
 29339                                  
 29340                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 29341                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29342                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29343                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 29344                                  	
 29345                                  	pop	es
 29346                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 29347                                  	pop	bx
 29348                                  
 29349                                  	retn
 29350                                  
 29351                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29352                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29353                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29354                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29355                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29356                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29357                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29358                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29359                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29360                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29361                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29362                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29363                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29364                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29365                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29366                                  
 29367                                  gnradix:
 29368                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29369                                  
 29370                                  toDigit:
 29371                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29372                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29373                                  
 29374                                  toDigit_hex:
 29375                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29376                                  	jb	short td10
 29377                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29378                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29379                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 29380                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29381                                  	retn
 29382                                  td10:	
 29383                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 29384                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 29385                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 29386                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 29387                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 29388                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29389                                  	retn
 29390                                  toDigit_dec:
 29391                                  td20:	
 29392                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 29393                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 29394                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 29395                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 29396                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 29397                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 29398                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29399                                  	retn
 29400                                  tdE:	
 29401                                  	stc
 29402                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 29403                                  	retn
 29404                                  
 29405                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29406                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 29407                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29408                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 29409                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 29410                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 29411                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 29412                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29413                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29414                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29415                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29416                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29417                                  
 29418                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29419                                  
 29420                                  GetXNum:
 29421                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 29422                                  	push	bx
 29423                                  	push	cx
 29424                                  	push	ds
 29425                                  
 29426                                  	cld
 29427                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29428                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29429                                  	xor	cx,cx
 29430                                  	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 29431                                  
 29432                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 29433                                  
 29434                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 29435                                  	;call	toDigit
 29436                                  	call	toDigit_dec
 29437                                  	jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 29438                                  
 29439                                  	or	cl,cl
 29440                                  	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 29441                                  	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 29442                                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 29443                                  	je	short gxn10
 29444                                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 29445                                  	jne	short gxn20
 29446                                  
 29447                                  gxn10:	
 29448                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 29449                                  	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 29450                                  	inc	si
 29451                                  
 29452                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29453                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 29454                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 29455                                  ;        BX    = 0
 29456                                  ;        CH    = 0
 29457                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29458                                  
 29459                                  gxn20:	
 29460                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 29461                                  	inc	si
 29462                                  
 29463                                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 29464                                  	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 29465                                  
 29466                                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 29467                                  	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 29468                                  
 29469                                  	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 29470                                  	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 29471                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 29472                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 29473                                  	jnc	short gxn20
 29474                                  gxnE:	
 29475                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 29476                                  	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 29477                                  gxnQ:	
 29478                                  	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 29479                                  	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 29480                                  gxnX:	
 29481                                  	pop	ds
 29482                                  	pop	cx
 29483                                  	pop	bx
 29484                                  	retn
 29485                                  
 29486                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29487                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 29488                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29489                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 29490                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 29491                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 29492                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29493                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29494                                  
 29495                                  mul32:
 29496                                  	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29497                                  	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29498                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29499                                  	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 29500                                  
 29501                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29502                                  	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29503                                  
 29504                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29505                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29506                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29507                                  	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29508                                  	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29509                                  	retn
 29510                                  m32E:	
 29511                                  	pop	ax
 29512                                  	retn
 29513                                  
 29514                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29515                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 29516                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29517                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 29518                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 29519                                  ; ERROR:   None
 29520                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29521                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29522                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 29523                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 29524                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29525                                  
 29526                                  toPara:
 29527                                  	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 29528                                  
 29529                                  	mov	cl,4		;
 29530                                  	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 29531                                  	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 29532                                  	mov	cl,12
 29533                                  	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 29534                                  	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 29535                                  
 29536                                  	pop	cx
 29537                                  	retn
 29538                                  
 29539                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29540                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 29541                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29542                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 29543                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 29544                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 29545                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29546                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29547                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 29548                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 29549                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 29550                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 29551                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29552                                  
 29553                                  UmbHead:
 29554                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 29555                                  
 29556                                  	;push	si ; ?
 29557                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 29558                                  	;push	es
 29559                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 29560                                  
 29561                                  	; 09/04/2019
 29562                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 29563                                  
 29564                                  	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 29565                                  	int	21h
 29566                                  
 29567                                  	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 29568                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 29569                                  	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 29570                                  
 29571                                  	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 29572                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 29573                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29574                                  	retn
 29575                                  uhE:	
 29576                                  	stc
 29577                                  uhX:	
 29578                                  	;pop	bx ; *
 29579                                  	;pop	es
 29580                                  	;pop	ds ; ?
 29581                                  	;pop	si ; ?
 29582                                  	retn
 29583                                  
 29584                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29585                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 29586                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29587                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 29588                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 29589                                  ; USES:   Flags
 29590                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29591                                  
 29592                                  isSysMCB:
 29593                                  	;push	ax
 29594                                  
 29595                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 29596                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 29597                                  	;je	short ism10
 29598                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 29599                                  	;;je	short ism10
 29600                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 29601                                  	;jne	short ismX
 29602                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 29603                                  	jne	short ismX 
 29604                                  ism10:	
 29605                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 29606                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 29607                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 29608                                  ismX:	
 29609                                  	;pop	ax
 29610                                  	retn
 29611                                  
 29612                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29613                                  
 29614                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29615                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 29616                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29617                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 29618                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 29619                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 29620                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29621                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29622                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 29623                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 29624                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 29625                                  ;      ...
 29626                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 29627                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29628                                  
 29629                                  AddrToUmb:
 29630                                  	push	cx
 29631                                  	push	dx
 29632                                  	push	es
 29633                                  
 29634                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 29635                                  
 29636                                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 29637                                  	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 29638                                  
 29639                                  	mov	es,ax		; ES = first UMB segment
 29640                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 29641                                  
 29642                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 29643                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 29644                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 29645                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 29646                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 29647                                  
 29648                                  atu10:	mov	ax,es
 29649                                          cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 29650                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 29651                                  
 29652                                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 29653                                  	jnz	short atu20
 29654                                  
 29655                                  	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 29656                                  atu20:	
 29657                                  	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 29658                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 29659                                  	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 29660                                  
 29661                                  	;NextMCB es, ax
 29662                                  
 29663                                  	mov     ax,es
 29664                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 29665                                  	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29666                                  	inc     ax
 29667                                  	mov     es,ax
 29668                                  	
 29669                                  	jmp	short atu10
 29670                                  
 29671                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29672                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 29673                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 29674                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29675                                  
 29676                                  atu30:	
 29677                                  	mov	ax,es
 29678                                  	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29679                                  	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 29680                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 29681                                  atuE:	
 29682                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 29683                                  	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 29684                                  atuX:	
 29685                                  	mov	ax, cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 29686                                  	
 29687                                  	pop	es	
 29688                                  	pop	dx
 29689                                  	pop	cx
 29690                                  	retn
 29691                                  
 29692                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29693                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 29694                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 29695                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 29696                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 29697                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
