 32782                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32783                                  ;
 32784                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 32785                                  ;
 32786                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 32787                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 32788                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 32789                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 32790                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 32791                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 32792                                  ;
 32793                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 32794                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 32795                                  ;
 32796                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 32797                                  ;
 32798                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32799                                  
 32800                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32801                                  
 32802                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32803                                  setdeviceparameters:
 32804                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32805                                  	; ds = cs
 32806                                  	
 32807 00002DEA 06                      	push	es
 32808                                  
 32809 00002DEB 0E                      	push	cs
 32810 00002DEC 07                      	pop	es
 32811                                  
 32812 00002DED 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 32813 00002DEF 8A1E[E835]              	mov	bl,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 32814 00002DF3 80FB00                  	cmp	bl,DEV_5INCH ; 0
 32815 00002DF6 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 32816                                  
 32817 00002DF8 C706[EB35]2800          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 32818                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 32819                                  got_80:
 32820 00002DFE D1E3                    	shl	bx,1			; get index into bpb table
 32821 00002E00 8BB7[9037]              	mov	si,[bpbtable+bx]	; get address of bpb
 32822                                  
 32823                                  	;mov	di,deviceparameters+7	
 32824                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32825 00002E04 BF[EE35]                	mov	di,deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB ; es:di -> bpb
 32826 00002E07 B91F00                  	mov	cx,A_BPB.size ; 31
 32827 00002E0A FC                      	cld
 32828                                  	;repe	movsb
 32829                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32830 00002E0B F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 32831                                  
 32832 00002E0D 07                      	pop	es
 32833                                  
 32834                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32835 00002E0E F606[1037]20            	test	byte [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 32836                                  	;test	word [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 32837 00002E13 7406                    	jz	short see_heads
 32838                                  
 32839 00002E15 A1[0D37]                	mov	ax,[slim]
 32840                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+20],ax
 32841 00002E18 A3[FB35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],ax
 32842                                  
 32843                                  see_heads:
 32844                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32845 00002E1B F606[1037]40            	test	byte [switches],flagheads ; 40h
 32846                                  	;test	word [switches],flagheads ; 40h
 32847 00002E20 7406                    	jz	short heads_not_altered
 32848                                  
 32849 00002E22 A1[0B37]                	mov	ax,[hlim]
 32850                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+22],ax	
 32851 00002E25 A3[FD35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax
 32852                                  
 32853                                  heads_not_altered:
 32854                                  
 32855                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 32856                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 32857                                  
 32858                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+9],2
 32859                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32860                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 32861                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32862 00002E28 B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 32863 00002E2B A2[F035]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 32864                                  
 32865 00002E2E B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 32866                                  
 32867                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 32868                                  
 32869                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 32870                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32871 00002E30 8A3E[F835]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 32872                                  
 32873                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32874                                  	; ax = 2
 32875 00002E34 3906[FD35]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 32876                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 32877 00002E38 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediad ; just use default if heads>2
 32878                                  
 32879 00002E3A 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 32880                                  
 32881                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 32882                                  
 32883 00002E3C 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 32884                                  
 32885                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 32886                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 32887                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 32888                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 32889                                  
 32890                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 32891                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 32892                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 32893                                  
 32894 00002E3E 833E[FB35]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 32895 00002E43 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 32896 00002E45 833E[EB35]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 32897 00002E4A 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 32898                                  
 32899                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 32900                                  
 32901 00002E4C EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 32902                                  
 32903                                  ;	check for 320K
 32904                                  
 32905                                  not_144m:
 32906 00002E4E 833E[EB35]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 32907 00002E53 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 32908 00002E55 833E[FB35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 32909 00002E5A 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 32910                                  
 32911 00002E5C B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 32912 00002E5E EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 32913                                  
 32914                                  only_one_head:
 32915                                  
 32916                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 32917                                  
 32918 00002E60 803E[E835]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 32919 00002E65 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 32920                                  
 32921                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 32922                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 32923                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 32924                                  
 32925 00002E67 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 32926 00002E69 833E[FB35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 32927                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32928 00002E6E 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 32929                                  
 32930 00002E70 B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 32931                                  
 32932                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 32933                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 32934                                  
 32935                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 32936                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32937                                  	; ax = 2
 32938 00002E72 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 32939 00002E73 A2[F035]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 32940                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 32941                                  
 32942                                  got_correct_mediad:
 32943 00002E76 881E[F835]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 32944                                  
 32945                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 32946                                  
 32947 00002E7A A1[EB35]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 32948 00002E7D F726[FD35]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS]
 32949 00002E81 F726[FB35]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK]
 32950 00002E85 A3[F635]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS],ax
 32951 00002E88 F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 32952                                  
 32953 00002E89 C3                      	retn
 32954                                  
 32955                                  ;	M047 -- end rewritten routine
 32956                                  
 32957                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32958                                  ;
 32959                                  ; procedure : organize
 32960                                  ;

 32963                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 32966                                  organize:
 32967                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32968                                  	; ds = cs
 32969 00002E8A 8B0E[D203]              	mov	cx,[count]
 32970                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 32971 00002E8E E326                    	jcxz	nochar1
 32972                                  
 32973                                  ;ifndef	MULTI_CONFIG
 32974                                  ;
 32975                                  ;;   In MULTI_CONFIG, we map to upper case on a line-by-line basis,
 32976                                  ;;   because we the case of values in SET commands preserved
 32977                                  ;
 32978                                  ;	call	mapcase
 32979                                  ;endif
 32980                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32981 00002E90 E81B02                  	call	mapcase
 32982                                  
 32983 00002E93 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 32984 00002E95 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 32985 00002E97 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 32986                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)	
 32987                                  	;;mov	byte [cs:com_level],0
 32988                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32989                                  	;mov	[cs:com_level],al ; 0
 32990                                  	; 04/01/2023

 32992 00002E99 A2[CC03]                	mov	[com_level],al ; 0
 32993                                  org1:
 32994 00002E9C E8B101                  	call	skip_comment
 32995 00002E9F 740D                    	jz	short end_commd_line	; found a comment string and skipped.
 32996 00002EA1 E89601                  	call	get2			; not a comment string. then get a char.
 32997 00002EA4 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf ; 0Ah
 32998 00002EA6 7406                    	je	short end_commd_line	; starts with a blank line.
 32999 00002EA8 3C20                    	cmp	al,' ' ; 20h
 33000 00002EAA 76F0                    	jbe	short org1		; skip leading control characters
 33001 00002EAC EB0A                    	jmp	short findit
 33002                                  
 33003                                  end_commd_line:
 33004 00002EAE AA                      	stosb				; store line feed char in buffer for the linecount.
 33005                                  	;mov	byte [cs:com_level],0	; reset the command level.
 33006                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33007                                  	; ds = cs
 33008 00002EAF C606[CC03]00            	mov	byte [com_level],0
 33009 00002EB4 EBE6                    	jmp	short org1
 33010                                  
 33011                                  nochar1:
 33012 00002EB6 F9                      	stc
 33013 00002EB7 C3                      	retn
 33014                                  
 33015                                  findit:
 33016 00002EB8 51                      	push	cx
 33017 00002EB9 56                      	push	si
 33018 00002EBA 57                      	push	di
 33019 00002EBB 89F5                    	mov	bp,si
 33020 00002EBD 4D                      	dec	bp
 33021 00002EBE BE[5635]                        mov     si,comtab		; prepare to search command table
 33022 00002EC1 B500                    	mov	ch,0
 33023                                  findcom:
 33024 00002EC3 89EF                    	mov	di,bp
 33025 00002EC5 8A0C                    	mov	cl,[si]
 33026 00002EC7 46                      	inc	si
 33027 00002EC8 E324                    	jcxz	nocom
 33028                                  
 33029                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33030                                  
 33031                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 33032                                  ;
 33033                                  ;;   Simplify future parsing by collapsing ";" onto "REM", and at the same
 33034                                  ;;   time skip the upcoming delimiter test (since ";" need not be followed by
 33035                                  ;;   anything in particular)
 33036                                  ;
 33037                                  ;       cmp     byte [es:di],CONFIG_SEMICOLON  ; ';'
 33038                                  ;       je	short semicolon
 33039                                  ;loopcom:
 33040                                  ;       mov     al,[es:di]
 33041                                  ;       inc     di
 33042                                  ;       and     al,~20h ; 0DFh		; force upper case
 33043                                  ;       inc     si                      ; compare to byte @es:di
 33044                                  ;       cmp     al,[si-1]
 33045                                  ;       loope   loopcom
 33046                                  ;;else
 33047                                  ;;	repe	cmpsb
 33048                                  ;endif
 33049                                  	; 02/11/2022
 33050 00002ECA F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 33051                                  
 33052 00002ECC 9F                      	lahf
 33053 00002ECD 01CE                            add     si,cx                   ; bump to next position without affecting flags
 33054 00002ECF 9E                      	sahf
 33055 00002ED0 AC                              lodsb                           ; get indicator letter
 33056 00002ED1 75F0                    	jnz	short findcom
 33057 00002ED3 26803D0D                        cmp     byte [es:di],cr		; the next char might be cr,lf
 33058 00002ED7 7410                    	je	short gotcom0 		; such as in "rem",cr,lf case.
 33059 00002ED9 26803D0A                	cmp	byte [es:di],lf
 33060 00002EDD 740A                    	je	short gotcom0
 33061                                  
 33062                                  ; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33063                                  ;
 33064                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 33065                                  ;
 33066                                  ;;   Skip the delimiter test for the BEGIN identifier (it doesn't have one).
 33067                                  ;
 33068                                  ;       cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN  ; '['
 33069                                  ;       je	short gotcom0
 33070                                  ;;endif
 33071                                  ;	push	ax
 33072                                  ;       mov     al,[es:di]		; now the next char. should be a delim.
 33073                                  ;
 33074                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 33075                                  ;
 33076                                  ;;   If keyword is *immediately* followed by a question mark (?), then
 33077                                  ;;   set the high bit of the ASCII command code (CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY) that is
 33078                                  ;;   stored in the CONFIG.SYS memory image.
 33079                                  ;
 33080                                  ;       cmp     al,'?'                  ; explicit interactive command?
 33081                                  ;       jne	short no_query		; no
 33082                                  ;       pop     ax                      ; yes, so retrieve the original code
 33083                                  ;       or      al,CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY  ; and set the QUERY bit
 33084                                  ;       jmp     short gotcom0           ;
 33085                                  ;semicolon:
 33086                                  ;       mov     al,CONFIG_REM
 33087                                  ;       jmp     short gotcom0
 33088                                  ;no_query:
 33089                                  ;;endif  ;MULTI_CONFIG
 33090                                  
 33091                                  	; 02/11/2022
 33092 00002EDF 50                      	push	ax
 33093 00002EE0 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di]		; now the next char. should be a delim.
 33094                                  
 33095 00002EE3 E8A001                  	call	delim
 33096                                  no_delim:
 33097 00002EE6 58                      	pop	ax
 33098 00002EE7 75DA                    	jnz	short findcom
 33099                                  gotcom0:
 33100 00002EE9 5F                      	pop	di
 33101 00002EEA 5E                      	pop	si
 33102 00002EEB 59                      	pop	cx
 33103 00002EEC EB0F                    	jmp	short gotcom
 33104                                  nocom:
 33105 00002EEE 5F                      	pop	di
 33106 00002EEF 5E                      	pop	si

 33426                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33427                                  ;
 33428                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 33429                                  ;
 33430                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 33431                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 33432                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 33433                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 33434                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 33435                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 33436                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 33437                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 33438                                  ;
 33439                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33440                                  
 33441                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33442                                  
 33443                                  skip_comment:
 33444 00003050 E3EE                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 33445                                  
 33446                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33447                                  	; ds = cs	
 33448                                  
 33449 00003052 803E[CC03]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 33450                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 33451 00003057 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 33452                                  
 33453 00003059 803E[CD03]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 33454                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 33455 0000305E 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 33456                                  
 33457 00003060 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33458                                  	
 33459 00003063 3806[CE03]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 33460                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 33461 00003067 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 33462                                  
 33463 00003069 803E[CD03]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 33464                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 33465 0000306E 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33466                                  
 33467 00003070 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 33468                                  	
 33469 00003074 3806[CF03]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 33470                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 33471 00003078 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 33472                                  skip_cmmt:
 33473 0000307A E3C4                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 33474 0000307C 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33475 0000307F 46                      	inc	si
 33476 00003080 49                      	dec	cx
 33477 00003081 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 33478 00003083 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33479                                  no_commt:
 33480 00003085 C3                      	retn
 33481                                  
 33482                                  ; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33483                                  %if 0
 33484                                  
 33485                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 33486                                  
 33487                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33488                                  ;
 33489                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 33490                                  ;
 33491                                  ;   INPUT
 33492                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 33493                                  ;
 33494                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33495                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 33496                                  ;
 33497                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33498                                  ;       All
 33499                                  ;
 33500                                  ;   HISTORY
 33501                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 33502                                  ;
 33503                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33504                                  
 33505                                  kbd_read:
 33506                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 33507                                          jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 33508                                  
 33509                                          push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 33510                                          sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 33511                                          mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 33512                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 33513                                  kbd_loop:
 33514                                          mov     ah,1            ;
 33515                                          int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 33516                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 33517                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33518                                          int     16h             ;
 33519                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33520                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 33521                                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 33522                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 33523                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33524                                  	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 33525                                  
 33526                                  	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?
 33527                                          jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 33528                                  kbd_loopdone:
 33529                                          pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 33530                                  kbd_nodelay:
 33531                                          sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 33532                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33533                                          int     16h             ;
 33534                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33535                                          jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 33536                                          inc     bx              ; yes
 33537                                          inc     bx
 33538                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 33539                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 33540                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 33541                                          mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 33542                                          int     16h             ;
 33543                                          jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 33544                                          or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 33545                                          jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 33546                                  
 33547                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 33548                                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 33549                                          je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 33550                                  	
 33551                                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 33552                                          jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 33553                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 33554                                          mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 33555                                          call    print
 33556                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 33557                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4           ;
 33558                                          jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 33559                                  kbd_notf5:
 33560                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 33561                                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 33562                                          je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 33563                                  
 33564                                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 33565                                          jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 33566                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 33567                                          mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 33568                                          call    print           ;
 33569                                          mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 33570                                          mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 33571                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 33572                                          mov     ah,0            ;
 33573                                          int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 33574                                          mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 33575                                          or      bx,bx           ;
 33576                                          jz	short kbd_clean	;
 33577                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 33578                                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 33579                                          jb	short kbd_exit	;
 33580                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 33581                                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 33582                                          stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 33583                                          retn			;
 33584                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 33585                                          clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 33586                                          retn			;
 33587                                  
 33588                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33589                                  ;
 33590                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 33591                                  ;
 33592                                  ;   INPUT
 33593                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 33594                                  ;
 33595                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33596                                  ;       None
 33597                                  ;
 33598                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33599                                  ;       None
 33600                                  ;
 33601                                  ;   HISTORY
 33602                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 33603                                  ;
 33604                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33605                                  
 33606                                  set_numlock:
 33607                                          push    ax
 33608                                          push    ds
 33609                                          sub     ax,ax
 33610                                          mov     ds,ax
 33611                                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 33612                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 33613                                          jne	short not_off	; no
 33614                                          and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 33615                                          jmp     short set_done
 33616                                  not_off:
 33617                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 33618                                          stc
 33619                                          jne	short set_done	; no
 33620                                          or      byte [0417h],20h
 33621                                  set_done:
 33622                                          pop     ds
 33623                                          pop     ax
 33624                                          retn
 33625                                  
 33626                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33627                                  
 33628                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33629                                  ;
 33630                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 33631                                  ;
 33632                                  ;   INPUT
 33633                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 33634                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 33635                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 33636                                  ;
 33637                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33638                                  ;       Same as above;  the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 33639                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 33640                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 33641                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 33642                                  ;
 33643                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33644                                  ;       All
 33645                                  ;
 33646                                  ;   NOTES
 33647                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 33648                                  ;
 33649                                  ;   HISTORY
 33650                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 33651                                  ;
 33652                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33653                                  
 33654                                  menu_check:
 33655                                  
 33656                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present;  if so, then
 33657                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 33658                                  
 33659                                          push    cx              ;
 33660                                          push    si              ;
 33661                                          sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 33662                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 33663                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 33664                                          jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 33665                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 33666                                          jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 33667                                          inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 33668                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 33669                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 33670                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 33671                                          jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 33672                                          or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 33673                                          jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 33674                                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 33675                                          mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 33676                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 33677                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 33678                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 33679                                          jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 33680                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 33681                                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 33682                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 33683                                          cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 33684                                          je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 33685                                          cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 33686                                          jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 33687                                          call    get_char        ;
 33688                                          and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 33689                                          cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 33690                                          jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 33691                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 33692                                          jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 33693                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 33694                                          cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 33695                                          jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 33696                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 33697                                          jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 33698                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 33699                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 33700                                          jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 33701                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 33702                                          pop     si              ;
 33703                                          pop     cx              ;
 33704                                  
 33705                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 33706                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 33707                                  
 33708                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 33709                                          jnz	short menu_search
 33710                                  ;
 33711                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 33712                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 33713                                  ;
 33714                                          call    kbd_read
 33715                                          jnc	short menu_search
 33716                                          jmp	menu_abort
 33717                                  
 33718                                  ;   Search for MENU block;  it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 33719                                  
 33720                                  menu_search:
 33721                                          sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 33722                                          mov     di,szMenu	;
 33723                                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 33724                                          jnc	short menu_found ;
 33725                                          mov     byte [szBoot],0
 33726                                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 33727                                  
 33728                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 33729                                  
 33730                                  menu_color:
 33731                                          push    cx              ;
 33732                                          push    dx              ;
 33733                                          mov     dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 33734                                          call    get_number	; get first number
 33735                                          and     bl,0Fh		; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 33736                                          mov     ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 33737                                          and     dl,0F0h         ;
 33738                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 33739                                          call    delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 33740                                          jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 33741                                          call    get_number	; get next number
 33742                                          and     bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 33743                                          mov     dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 33744                                          and     dl,0Fh		;
 33745                                          mov     cl,4            ;
 33746                                          shl     bl,cl           ;
 33747                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 33748                                  check_color:                    ;
 33749                                          cmp     ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 33750                                          jne	short set_color	; no
 33751                                          xor     dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 33752                                  set_color:
 33753                                          mov     [bMenuColor],dl ;
 33754                                          pop     dx              ;
 33755                                          pop     cx              ;
 33756                                          jmp	menu_nextitem
 33757                                  
 33758                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 33759                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 33760                                  
 33761                                  menu_found:
 33762                                          mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 33763                                          mov     word [offDefBlock],0
 33764                                          mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 33765                                          and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 33766                                  
 33767                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 33768                                          sub     dx,dx           ; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 33769                                  
 33770                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 33771                                  
 33772                                  menu_process:
 33773                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 33774                                          jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 33775                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 33776                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 33777                                          je	short to_menu_getdefault
 33778                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 33779                                          je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 33780                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 33781                                          je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 33782                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 33783                                          je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 33784                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 33785                                          je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 33786                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 33787                                          je	short menu_numlock ;
 33788                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 33789                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 33790                                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 33791                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 33792                                          stc                     ;
 33793                                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 33794                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 33795                                  menu_numlock:
 33796                                          call    set_numlock
 33797                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 33798                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 33799                                          jmp     short menu_getdefault
 33800                                  
 33801                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 33802                                  
 33803                                  menu_default:
 33804                                          mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 33805                                          cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 33806                                          jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 33807                                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 33808                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 33809                                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 33810                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 33811                                          mov     si,bx           ;
 33812                                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 33813                                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 33814                                          jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 33815                                          mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 33816                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 33817                                          mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 33818                                  timeout_skip:
 33819                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 33820                                  
 33821                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 33822                                  
 33823                                  menu_item:
 33824                                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 33825                                          jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 33826                                          mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 33827                                          call    srch_block      ;
 33828                                          je	short menu_itemfound ;
 33829                                          stc                     ;
 33830                                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 33831                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 33832                                  
 33833                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 33834                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 33835                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 33836                                  
 33837                                  menu_itemfound:
 33838                                          inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 33839                                          mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 33840                                          mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 33841                                          add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 33842                                  
 33843                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 33844                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 33845                                  ;   description...
 33846                                  
 33847                                          mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 33848                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 33849                                          mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 33850                                          call    skip_token      ;
 33851                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 33852                                          call    skip_delim      ;
 33853                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 33854                                          xchg    bx,di           ;
 33855                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 33856                                  
 33857                                  menu_nextitem:
 33858                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 33859                                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 33860                                  
 33861                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 33862                                  
 33863                                  menu_getdefault:
 33864                                          or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 33865                                          jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 33866                                          sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 33867                                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 33868                                  menu_valid:
 33869                                          sub     bx,bx           ;
 33870                                          mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 33871                                          mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 33872                                          or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 33873                                          jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 33874                                          inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 33875                                  menu_chkdefault:
 33876                                          push    bx              ;
 33877                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 33878                                          mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 33879                                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 33880                                          push    ds              ;
 33881                                          push    es              ;
 33882                                          pop     ds              ;
 33883                                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 33884                                          pop     ds              ;
 33885                                          pop     bx              ;
 33886                                          je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 33887                                          inc     bx              ;
 33888                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 33889                                          jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 33890                                  menu_nodefault:
 33891                                          mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 33892                                  menu_setdefault:
 33893                                          mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 33894                                  
 33895                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 33896                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 33897                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 33898                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 33899                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 33900                                  ;   with no timeout)
 33901                                  
 33902                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 33903                                          jne	short menu_display ; no
 33904                                          test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 33905                                          jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 33906                                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 33907                                  
 33908                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 33909                                  
 33910                                  menu_display:
 33911                                          mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 33912                                          int     10h             ;
 33913                                          mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 33914                                          int     10h             ;
 33915                                          push    es              ;
 33916                                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 33917                                          mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 33918                                          mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 33919                                          mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 33920                                          mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 33921                                          mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 33922                                          mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 33923                                          int     10h             ;
 33924                                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 33925                                          mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 33926                                          sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 33927                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 33928                                          mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 33929                                  	dec     dl              ;
 33930                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 33931                                          mov	dh,[es:84h]
 33932                                  	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 33933                                          jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 33934                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 33935                                  menu_clear:
 33936                                          int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 33937                                          pop     es              ;
 33938                                          mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 33939                                          mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 33940                                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 33941                                  
 33942                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 33943                                          jnz     short menu_nostatus
 33944                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 33945                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 33946                                          mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 33947                                          mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 33948                                          int     10h             ;
 33949                                          mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 33950                                          call    print           ;
 33951                                          mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 33952                                          int     10h             ;
 33953                                          sub     dl,2            ;
 33954                                          mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 33955                                  
 33956                                  menu_nostatus:
 33957                                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 33958                                  menu_disploop:
 33959                                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 33960                                          inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"?  because it's a 1-byte opcode
 33961                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 33962                                          jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 33963                                  
 33964                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 33965                                  
 33966                                          mov     dl,0            ; select column
 33967                                          mov     dh,bl           ;
 33968                                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 33969                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 33970                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 33971                                          int     10h             ;
 33972                                  
 33973                                          mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 33974                                          call    print           ;
 33975                                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 33976                                          mov     dx,crlfm	
 33977                                          call    print           ;
 33978                                          push    word [bDisableUI]
 33979                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 33980                                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 33981                                          pop     word [bDisableUI]
 33982                                  
 33983                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 33984                                  
 33985                                  menu_autoselect:
 33986                                          cmp     bx,-1           ; clean boot requested?
 33987                                          jne	short normal_boot ; no
 33988                                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 33989                                  menu_abort:
 33990                                          sub     cx,cx           ; then immediately exit with 0 config.sys image
 33991                                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 33992                                  
 33993                                  normal_boot:
 33994                                          cmp     bx,-2           ; back to top-level menu?
 33995                                          jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 33996                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 33997                                          sub     si,si           ;
 33998                                          jmp     menu_search
 33999                                  
 34000                                  not_topmenu:
 34001                                          cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 34002                                          jne	short not_submenu
 34003                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 34004                                          mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 34005                                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 34006                                          mov     si,di           ;
 34007                                          mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 34008                                          jmp     menu_found
 34009                                  
 34010                                  not_submenu:
 34011                                          add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 34012                                          mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 34013                                  
 34014                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 34015                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 34016                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 34017                                  
 34018                                  no_selection:
 34019                                          mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 34020                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 34021                                          sub     si,si           ;
 34022                                          push    ds              ;
 34023                                          mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 34024                                          sub     di,di           ;
 34025                                  
 34026                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 34027                                  ;
 34028                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 34029                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 34030                                  ;   within the requested block.  Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 34031                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion;  the amount of recursion is
 34032                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 34033                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 34034                                  ;
 34035                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 34036                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 34037                                  
 34038                                  copyblock_loop:
 34039                                          push    bx              ; save selected block name
 34040                                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 34041                                          pop     bx              ;
 34042                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 34043                                  
 34044                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons:  it hit eof or a new block
 34045                                  
 34046                                  copyblock_begin:
 34047                                          push    ax              ;
 34048                                          push    cx              ;
 34049                                          push    si              ;
 34050                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 34051                                          mov     di,szCommon
 34052                                          push    ds              ;
 34053                                          push    cs              ;
 34054                                          pop     ds              ;
 34055                                          call    comp_names      ;
 34056                                          pop     ds              ;
 34057                                          pop     di              ;
 34058                                          pop     si              ;
 34059                                          pop     cx              ;
 34060                                          pop     ax              ;
 34061                                          je	short copyblock_check
 34062                                          or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 34063                                          jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 34064                                          push    di              ;
 34065                                          mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 34066                                          push    ds              ;
 34067                                          push    es              ;
 34068                                          pop     ds              ;
 34069                                          call    comp_names      ; is this the block we really want to do?
 34070                                          pop     ds              ;
 34071                                          pop     di              ;
 34072                                  copyblock_check:
 34073                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 34074                                          jne	short copyblock_skip  ;
 34075                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34076                                          jmp	short copyblock_loop 
 34077                                  
 34078                                  copyblock_skip:                 ;
 34079                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; this ain't the block we wanted, so skip it
 34080                                          call    get_char        ;
 34081                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 34082                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 34083                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 34084                                          je	short copyblock_begin
 34085                                          jmp     short copyblock_skip ; anything else is just skipped
 34086                                  ;
 34087                                  ;   To create as little risk to the rest of SysInit as little as possible,
 34088                                  ;   and to free the workspace at "config_wrkseg" for creating an environment,
 34089                                  ;   copy the new config.sys image to "confbot"
 34090                                  ;
 34091                                  move_config:
 34092                                          mov     cx,di           ; now copy workspace at DS:DI to "confbot"
 34093                                          push    cx              ;
 34094                                  ;
 34095                                  ;   But first, copy the CONFIG=<configuration><0> string to the workspace,
 34096                                  ;   since the configuration name only currently exists in the "confbot" area
 34097                                  ;
 34098                                   	;mov	cx,7
 34099                                  	mov     cx,szMenu-szBoot-1
 34100                                          mov     si,szBoot	; first copy the CONFIG= part
 34101                                          inc     di              ; skip a byte, in case absolutely nothing
 34102                                                                  ; was copied to the workspace, because we always
 34103                                                                  ; zero the first byte of the workspace (below)
 34104                                  copy_boot: 
 34105                                  	;lods    byte ptr cs:[si];
 34106                                          cs
 34107                                  	lodsb
 34108                                  	mov     [di],al         ;
 34109                                          inc     di              ;
 34110                                          loop    copy_boot       ;
 34111                                  
 34112                                          push    es              ; then copy the configuration name
 34113                                          mov     cx,128-7        ; put an upper limit on the name, to be safe
 34114                                          mov     si,[cs:offDefBlock]; ES:SI -> default block name
 34115                                          or      si,si           ; valid?
 34116                                          jnz	short l1	; yes
 34117                                          push    cs              ;
 34118                                          pop     es              ;
 34119                                          mov     si,szCommon
 34120                                  l1:     mov     al,[es:si]      ;
 34121                                          call    any_delim       ;
 34122                                          je	short l2	;
 34123                                          mov     [di],al         ;
 34124                                          inc     si              ;
 34125                                          inc     di              ;
 34126                                          loop    l1              ;
 34127                                  l2:     mov     byte [di],lf	; terminate the configuration string
 34128                                          pop     es              ;
 34129                                  
 34130                                  ;   Now we can copy "config_wrkseg" (DS) to "confbot" (ES)
 34131                                  
 34132                                          sub     di,di           ;
 34133                                          mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 34134                                          sub     si,si           ;
 34135                                          pop     cx              ; recover the size of "config_wrkseg"
 34136                                  
 34137                                          push    cx              ;
 34138                                          rep     movsb           ; moved!
 34139                                          pop     cx              ;
 34140                                          mov     ax,ds           ;
 34141                                          pop     ds              ;
 34142                                  
 34143                                  ;   Now that the config_wrkseg is available once again, we shall
 34144                                  ;   use it to create an environment. The first thing to go in will be
 34145                                  ;   the "CONFIG=configuration" thing. It is also important to zero
 34146                                  ;   the first byte of the workspace, so that copy_envvar knows the buffer
 34147                                  ;   is empty.
 34148                                  
 34149                                          push    es              ;
 34150                                          mov     es,ax           ;
 34151                                          inc     si              ; ES:SI -> "CONFIG=configuration"
 34152                                          mov     byte [es:0],0	;empty the environment block
 34153                                          call    copy_envvar     ; copy envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 34154                                          pop     es
 34155                                  
 34156                                  ;   Before returning, restore the default video page setting but do NOT
 34157                                  ;   do it using INT 10h's Set Active Page function, because if the menu was
 34158                                  ;   displayed on a different page, then it's because we don't want to see
 34159                                  ;   all the device driver/TSR goop (which goes to the default page)
 34160                                  
 34161                                  menu_done:
 34162                                          cmp     byte [bMenuPage],0
 34163                                          je	short menu_exit	;
 34164                                          push    es              ;
 34165                                          mov     ax,40h          ;
 34166                                          mov     es,ax           ;
 34167                                          mov     ax,[wCRTStart]  ;
 34168                                          mov     [es:004Eh],ax   ;
 34169                                          mov     al,[bCRTPage]   ;
 34170                                          mov     [es:0062h],al   ;
 34171                                          pop     es              ;
 34172                                  menu_exit:
 34173                                          mov     [count],cx      ; set new counts
 34174                                          mov     [org_count],cx  ;
